A minimum of five new full-time jobs must be maintained for a qualifying business or service enterprise to maintain eligibility for the incentives provided below. 
Sec. 26-304. - Enterprise zone tax incentives. 
(a)  In the area defined in section 26-302, Macon-Bibb County may exempt qualifying businesses from Macon-Bibb County ad valorem taxes, excluding property taxes imposed by school districts, that would otherwise be levied on the qualifying business and service enterprises in accordance with the following schedule hereafter referred to as the enterprise zone tax exemption schedule provided in O.C.G.A. § 36-88-8: 
(1)  One hundred percent of the property taxes shall be exempt for the first five years; 
(2)  Eighty percent of the property taxes shall be exempt for the next two years; 
(3)  Sixty percent of the property taxes shall be exempt for the next year; 
(4)  Forty percent of the property taxes shall be exempt for the next year; and 
(5)  Twenty percent of the property taxes shall be exempt for the last year. 
(b)  A minimum of five new jobs must be maintained for a qualifying business or service enterprise to maintain eligibility for the tax exemptions, fee waivers, and abatements provided pursuant to this section. Each qualifying business or service enterprise receiving an exemption herein shall provide the director, by December 31 of each year, a written report on the full-time job equivalents maintained by the business for the calendar year. 
(c)  If the project consists of new residential construction, residential rehabilitation, or other rehabilitation of an existing structure and the value of the improvement exceeds the value of the land by a ratio of five to one, then the enterprise zone tax exemption schedule of this section shall also apply whether or not the project is carried out by a qualifying business or service enterprise. 
(d)  Failure of any qualifying business or service enterprise receiving an exemption under this section to maintain its status as a qualifying business or service enterprise shall result in revocation of all incentives granted prior to the expiration of the incentive term. 
(e)  Macon-Bibb County further authorizes the director to negotiate on a case-by-case basis additional incentives for qualified business, provided that the mayor and commission approve such additional incentives by resolution before they become effective. 
Sec. 26-305. - Reservation of authority. 
Macon-Bibb County is the authorized agency to act in all matters pertaining to the enterprise zone and reserves the power to grant the incentives listed to qualifying businesses in accordance with the authorization granted to Macon-Bibb County in the Act. The mayor and commission reserve the right to amend this article at some future time to provide additional development incentives as authorized by state law. Such additional incentives shall be applicable upon adoption of an amendment to this article and shall run coterminous with the existing tax incentives above described. 
Sec. 26-306. - Designation of liaison. 
The director is hereby designated as the liaison for communication with the state department of community affairs, other state agencies, the business community, and all other interested parties in regards to enterprise zone activities and for all communications with the qualified businesses outlined herein. 
Sec. 26-307. - Administration of program. 
Macon-Bibb County has the power to administer, require, and enforce compliance with the provisions of the ordinances and such administrative rules or regulations adopted hereinafter by way of resolution, or as contained herein, including but not limited to reports and data information, from businesses within the enterprise zone to verify compliance with this article and state law. 
Sec. 26-308. - Contract required for incentives. 
As a condition precedent to receiving the incentives provided for herein, Macon-Bibb County shall require qualifying business to enter into a contractual agreement, with Macon-Bibb County, that outlines the incentives offered to the business and a guideline for the recapture, revocation, or reimbursement should the terms of the contract be violated by the target business. 
Sec. 26-309. - Property tax exemption cap. 
In no event shall the value of the property tax exemptions granted to qualifying business and service enterprises within an enterprise zone created by Macon-Bibb County exceed ten percent of the value of the property tax digest of Macon-Bibb County. 
Sec. 26-310. - Time limitations. 
Pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 36-88-10, the enterprise zone designated herein shall remain in existence for ten years from the first day of the calendar year immediately following its designation as an enterprise zone. Macon-Bibb County may enter into agreements with qualifying businesses or service enterprises in the enterprise zone to provide for modifications or termination of the tax and fee exemptions and abatements. Property tax incentives available to a qualified business or service enterprise in the enterprise zone shall remain in effect for the full ten-year period established herein, regardless of the termination of the designation of the enterprise zone. 
ARTICLE IX. - [REPAIR AND REGISTRATION OF PAVED, NON-PUBLIC, ROADS—] IN GENERAL[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, adopted May 6, 2014 , set out provisions for use herein as art. I, "In General." For the purposes of clarity, those provisions have been included herein as art. IX, "Repair and Registration of Paved, Non-Public, Roads—In General." 

Sec. 26-311. - Constitutional Authority. 
The Commission is authorized pursuant to Article IX, Section II, Paragraph VI of the Constitution of the State of Georgia to create special districts for the provision of local government services within such districts, and to levy and collect fees, assessments and taxes within such district to pay, wholly or partially, the cost of providing such services therein. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-312. - Statement of Policy and Purpose. 
The purpose of this ordinance is to provide citizens of Macon-Bibb County with a procedure to petition for the repair and registration of paved roadways that have not been established as public roads of Macon-Bibb County so that they may be added to the Public Road Register and maintained as public road of Macon-Bibb County. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-313. - Definitions. 
Lot owner. The term "lot owner" as used in this ordinance shall include all persons holding fee simple title according to the real estate records of the County to real property within a proposed road repair district at the time the road repair petition and road registration deed form is submitted for the creation of said district as provided herein. For the purpose of the petitioning of the Macon-Bibb County Commission for the creation of a new road repair and registration tax district, the lot owner/owners shall have one vote per platted lot within a particular proposed road repair and registration district. "Lot owner" shall not include tenants in possession of property within the road repair and registration district. 
Road repair and registration district. The term "road repair and registration district" is a specific type of special tax district within Macon-Bibb County. A special tax district is authorized pursuant to Article IX, Section II, Paragraph VI of the Constitution of the State of Georgia. Road repair and registration districts may be created in order for lot owners to amortize the cost of road repairs within the district where they are seeking to have said roads entered upon the Public Road Register. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-314. - Districts; How Created; Responsibility for Costs. 
(a)  Any lot owner in Macon-Bibb County may present a Road Repair Petition and Road Registration Form to the Macon-Bibb County Engineering Department where said roadways are paved. 
(b)  The Road Repair Petition and Road Registration Deed Form must be completed in its entirety and a plat of the area to be repaired and registered attached to the form. 
(c)  The petitioner must obtain signatures from 50% + 1 (more than 50%) of the lot owners located in the potential road repair and registration tax district. The signatures must be notarized. Engineering, with assistance from the Macon-Bibb County Tax Assessors Office, will verify that the notarized signatures on the form represent the actual owners of record for each property. In addition, each form must designate a district resident as the "district contact person", responsible for communication between Macon-Bibb County and the district pertaining to its road repair and registration district. 
(d)  Unless 100% of the lot owners have signed the petition, the Macon-Bibb County Commission shall conduct at least one public hearing after having advertised the request one time in the official legal organ of Macon-Bibb County, and a sign or signs shall be posted in the proposed road repair and registration district giving notice of the hearing at least 10(ten) days before the public hearing. 
(e)  By signing the Road Repair Petition and Road Registration Deed Form, all petitioners within the subdivision or neighborhood shall be deemed to have actual or constructive notice of this ordinance and all the provisions contained herein, as well as the road repair and registration district. 
(f)  The Macon-Bibb County Engineering Department will provide an estimate for the cost of road repairs necessary to bring the roads up to standard. The estimate will be given to the property owners. 
(g)  The choice as to the type, method and time of the accomplishment of repairs shall be entirely discretionary with the governing authority of Macon-Bibb County. 
(h)  Special tax districts which shall be known as road repair and registration districts may be created upon the submission of the proper Road Repair Petition and Road Registration Deed Form to the Macon-Bibb County Engineering Department and submission of a resolution to the Macon-Bibb County Commission. Each new road repair and registration district so created shall be assigned a number and be designated by recorded plats showing each lot therein. 
(i)  A register of road repair and registration districts shall be maintained in the office of the Macon-Bibb Superior Court Clerk or his or her designee and the office of the Macon-Bibb County Tax Commissioner. Such registers shall be available to the public for inspection upon reasonable notice to either of these offices. 
(j)  The cost of repairing the paved road or roads shall be advanced by Macon-Bibb County. Macon-Bibb County shall have the authority to contract with the necessary parties to complete the job. This cost shall then be paid by the residents of the road repair and registration tax district and amortized up to a year or period of years as determined by the Macon-Bibb County Commission. The amortized cost of repairs shall be assigned to each platted lot. Each lot, whether vacant or improved, will pay the same assessment. The road repair and registration tax district shall end upon the payment of the amortized cost to Macon-Bibb County. 
(k)  Unless and until the Macon-Bibb County Commission shall have accepted the paved road(s) or street(s), the same shall not be deemed to be a public road so as to become a part of the Macon-Bibb County street and road system or to require maintenance and improvement by Macon-Bibb County. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-315. - Street/Road Standards. 
Street/road standards can be located in Chapter 25, Article II, Division 2 of the Code of Ordinances of Macon-Bibb County. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-316. - Lien of fees; payment; levy. 
(a)  The charges for road repair in each road repair and registration district shall be paid as a road repair assessment and shall be collected concurrently with the ad valorem tax billed to each lot owner within each road repair and registration tax district. The date for determining ownership of each lot shall be January 1 st of each year. 
(b)  The administration, payment and accounting of the amortized cost herein authorized shall be the responsibility of the Macon-Bibb County Commission or some department of the Macon-Bibb County government to which responsibility shall be assigned by the Macon-Bibb County Commission. Any proration of charges between the owners of lots to which title is transferred during any year shall be the responsibility of the buyers and sellers of such lots. 
(c)  The office of the Macon-Bibb County Tax Commissioner shall be responsible for the timely collection of taxes, fees and assessments assessed to each road repair and registration district and shall remit such sums to the Macon-Bibb County Commission in the same manner as other taxes are remitted. 
(d)  The fees herein prescribed shall be deemed in all respects to be governed by the rules and ordinances respecting ad valorem taxes in Macon-Bibb County. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-317. - Liens. 
In addition to any other rights of collection for late or unpaid charges, Macon-Bibb County shall have all rights available under the laws of the State of Georgia for the assessment and creation of a lien upon the property of the owner receiving the service provided, together with all rights of execution, levy, foreclosure and sale. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-318. - Applicability of ordinance. 
This ordinance shall only be applicable to paved road(s). Roads may become public roads by being dedicated and the County's acceptance as evidenced by resolution of the Macon-Bibb County Commission. By signing the road repair petition and road registration deed form, petitioners agree to dedicate for road purposes, the right-of-way for said roads in so far as his or her land is included in said right-of-way. The right-of-way must be surveyed and a plat of said survey shall be attached to the road repair petition and road registration form. The cost in obtaining said survey plat shall be incurred by petitioners. Where the right of way shown on the original plat of the subdivision is still valid, it will be deemed to meet this requirement. 
In order present Macon-Bibb County with fee simple title to the roads, the lot owners may have to locate the developer with the authority to deed over the roads to Macon-Bibb County. This will be at the expense of the lot owners and the lot owners may obtain representation by counsel to expedite the process at their own expense. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-319. - Federal, State Laws to Prevail. 
If any provisions of this ordinance is in conflict with any state or federal law, or with any rule, regulation, or any order of any agency of this state or federal agency having jurisdiction of the subject matter of this ordinance, it is hereby deemed to be the intention of the Macon-Bibb County Commission that the state or federal law or rule, regulation or order shall prevail such that the remaining portion of this ordinance shall be deemed to be of full force or effect. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Sec. 26-320. - Exceptions. 
The Macon-Bibb County Commission may make exceptions to this ordinance when warranted by exceptional circumstances. 
( Ord. No. O-2014-32, § 1, 5-6-2014 ) 
Secs. 26-321—26-399. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE X. - MIDDLE GEORGIA EDUCATION CORRIDOR BUSINESS IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT (BID)[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, adopted June 16, 2015 , set out provisions for use herein as art. VIII. For the purposes of clarity, those provisions have been included herein as art. X. 

Sec. 26-400. - Findings. 
Section 36-43-1 et seq., O.C.G.A., authorizes municipalities to establish city business improvement districts for the purpose of providing supplemental service to such districts by imposing assessments on property. Macon-Bibb County has received a petition requesting the establishment of a city business improvement district for the Middle Georgia Education Corridor from property owners representing more than 51 percent of the total property value in the proposed district. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Sec. 26-401. - Established. 
(a)  There is hereby established a business improvement district in Macon-Bibb County, Georgia known as the Middle Georgia Education Corridor Business Improvement District (the "district"). 
(b)  The legal boundaries of the district shall be set forth on an official map (the "business improvement district map") which is a part of an official plan for the district (the "district management plan") presented for final approval to the Macon-Bibb County Commission on June 16, 2015. A copy of the business improvement district map shall remain on file and available for inspection in the office of the Bibb County Tax Commissioner and the Macon-Bibb County Clerk of Commission. The business improvement district map is hereby adopted and made a part of this article. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Sec. 26-402. - Adoption of district plan. 
(a)  The district management plan is hereby adopted and made a part of this section. A copy of the district management plan shall remain on file and available for inspection in the office of the Bibb County Tax Commissioner and the Macon-Bibb County Clerk of Commission. 
(b)  The Macon-Bibb County Commission shall have the right to amend the district management plan at such time or times as the Macon-Bibb County Commission may deem appropriate. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Sec. 26-403. - Establishment of ad valorem tax rates. 
(a)  Excluding all real property classified as residential for assessment purposes, there is hereby established an annual millage rate of $0.005 Mills (Per Dollar of Assessed Value) upon all real property located within the district, which millage rate is in addition to all millage rates upon real property previously established for property located in the district. 
(b)  Notwithstanding annual assessment adjustments to reflect the annual change in the Middle Georgia Education Corridor Consumer Price Index (CPI) for all urban consumers as authorized under Section Six (6) of the district management plan, the millage rate authorized pursuant to this section shall be subject to change annually by the Macon-Bibb County Commission at the time that Macon-Bibb County approves its annual operating and capital improvements budgets, and at such other times as may be deemed appropriate by the Macon-Bibb County Commission; provided, however, that in no event shall the millage rate change authorized in this section or the district management plan exceed one (1) Mill. 
(c)  Excluding real property classified as residential for assessment purposes, the taxes established or authorized pursuant to this section shall be assessed against the real property in the district, shall be liens upon that property until paid, and such liens shall be enforceable in the same manner as other Macon-Bibb County tax liens. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Sec. 26-404. - Collection and expenditure of funds. 
All funds collected pursuant to this article may only be expended for supplemental services provided in the district management plan (as may be amended from time to time and) adopted by the Macon-Bibb County Commission. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Sec. 26-405. - Termination of District. 
Pursuant to O.C.G.A. Sec. 36-43-9, the district will have a six (6) year life span beginning July 1, 2015, and ending June 30, 2021. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0027, § 1, 6-16-2015 ) 
Chapter 27 - TAXICABS AND VEHICLES FOR HIRE 
ARTICLE I. - TAXICABS 

Secs. 27-1—27-25. - Reserved. 
Sec. 27-26. - Definitions. 
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
License means a business licensed issued under the licenses and business regulations chapter of this Code and under this chapter. 
Limousine means a motor-driven vehicle of not more than a nine-passenger capacity operated by the owner thereof, or an agent, lessee or employee of the owner and which is regularly available to the public to transport persons for profit, from point to point within and about Macon-Bibb County, the charges to be based primarily on the length of time the vehicle is used. 
Permit means a permit granting an individual the permission to operate a taxicab within Macon-Bibb County. 
Taxicab means a motor-driven vehicle of not more than an eight-passenger capacity, operated by the owner thereof, or an agent, lessee or employee of the owner and which is regularly available to the public to transport persons for profit, from point to point within and about Macon-Bibb County, the charges to be based primarily on the distance traveled. 
Taxicab business means any separately owned and operated taxicab, a fleet of owned or leased taxicabs, or fleet of taxicabs owned separately but operating under one name. 
Sec. 27-27. - License; application procedure. 
(a)  Required. Every person desiring to operate a taxicab business within Macon-Bibb County or on any Macon-Bibb County property outside Macon-Bibb County shall be required to have a license as defined in this article. 
(b)  Application information. Any person seeking a license hereunder, in addition to meeting the business license application requirements generally, shall also provide the department of business development services with the make, model, year, motor number, length of time in use, total mileage, and passenger capacity of each vehicle to be used as a taxicab in the taxicab business for which the application is being made. 
(c)  Reserved. 
(d)  Rate schedule. Macon-Bibb County shall maintain a rate schedule for the licenses to be issued under this article, such schedule to be based on the number of taxicabs to be operated in the taxicab business. 
(e)  Liability insurance. Every applicant for a taxicab business license shall, before the license is granted, deposit with the department of business development services, for each taxicab for which the privilege to operate is sought, a policy or certificate of liability insurance which meets the minimum requirements prescribed by the state for liability insurance policies on automobiles, presently contained in O.C.G.A. § 33-34-4, and as may be hereafter amended. The certificate or policy of insurance shall identify by serial number all vehicles insured under the policy and shall contain a provision obligating the insurance company issuing such policy to give at least ten days' written notice of cancellation or change in the policy to the department of business development services. In lieu of such policy or certificate of insurance, an applicant may deposit a certificate of self-insurance required from the department of public safety of the state pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 40-9-101. The license for the operation of the taxicab business shall expire upon the lapse or cancellation or termination or revocation of any policy or certificate of contract of insurance or any certificate of self-insurance covering any taxicab operated by the taxicab business. 
(f)  Issuance. Upon compliance with the requirements of this section, the payment of all appropriate license fees and business taxes, and meeting the other requirements as may be prescribed in this article, the department of business development services may issue the taxicab business license, numbered copies of which shall be provided for each vehicle. 
(g)  Penalty. No vehicle shall be operated as a taxicab upon the streets of Macon-Bibb County unless such vehicle has been licensed under the provisions of this article for use as a taxicab. The operator of any vehicle operating as a taxicab without having a current valid license for that vehicle shall be subject to a fine of not less than $250.00. This subsection shall not apply to a taxicab licensed in another jurisdiction which delivers a passenger to Macon-Bibb County from another city or county or picks up a passenger in Macon-Bibb County for transport to another city or county. 
Sec. 27-28. - Operator's permit. 
(a)  Every person desiring to operate a taxicab within Macon-Bibb County or on any Macon-Bibb County property outside Macon-Bibb County shall be required to have an operator's permit issued by the department of business development services officer under this Code. This subsection shall not apply to a taxicab licensed in another jurisdiction which delivers a passenger to Macon-Bibb County from another city or county or picks up a passenger in Macon-Bibb County for transport to another city or county. 
(b)  Applicants for a taxicab operator's permit shall register with the department of business development services, furnishing name, address, a valid driver's license issued by the state, a set of three photographs which clearly and accurately depict the applicant's face from full front view, and any other information the department of business development services may reasonably require. The applicant shall also allow his fingerprints to be taken by the sheriff. 
(c)  The application shall be reviewed by the sheriff for any criminal record and for any record of traffic violations. Notwithstanding the date of conviction, plea of guilty or nolo contendere to any offense described in subsections (d) or (e), the fact that an applicant is on probation or parole as a result of any such offense may be a factor considered by the issuing authority in determining whether to issue a taxicab operator's permit. 
(d)  No person shall be issued a permit to operate a taxicab in Macon-Bibb County if the records check reveals any of the following conditions: 
(1)  A conviction, plea of guilty or nolo contendere to an offense constituting a felony against the person of another within the five years immediately preceding the application for such permit; 
(2)  A conviction, plea of guilty, or nolo contendere to any other felony within three years immediately preceding the application for such permit; 
(3)  A conviction, plea of guilty, or nolo contendere to an offense involving prostitution, solicitation for prostitution, or the illegal manufacture, sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages or drugs during the three years immediately preceding the date of application for such permit; or 
(4)  A conviction, plea of guilty or plea of nolo contendere to DUI (driving under the influence) during the year immediately preceding the date of application for such permit. 
(e)  An applicant having two or more convictions, pleas of guilty or pleas of nolo contendere to DUI during a three year period of time shall not be eligible to receive to taxicab operator's permit for a period of five years following the date of the most recent DUI conviction or plea. 
(f)  Applicants for a taxicab operator's permit shall be required to sign an agreement whereby they obligate themselves to meet minimum dress code requirements and standards of conduct and appearance as set out below. 
(1)  Drivers shall be clean and neat in appearance. A shirt must be worn; no sleeveless or collarless shirts or blouses; no cut-off pants. 
(2)  Drivers shall be clean-shaven or shall maintain neatly trimmed mustaches or beards. 
(g)  After investigation and approval by the sheriff, the payment of a $15.00 license fee and meeting other requirements of this chapter, Macon-Bibb County may issue the operator's permit as required by this article. 
(h)  The operator's permit shall be displayed within the taxicab being operated, in plain view of passengers, whenever the taxicab is in operation. 
Sec. 27-29. - License amendment. 
(a)  Any person receiving a license under this article shall be required to amend the license application, originally filed for the license, to include new taxicabs or exclude old taxicabs promptly upon adding or deleting such vehicles from the taxicab business so that an up-to-date list of operating taxicabs may be maintained. 
(b)  The numbered license tag issued by the department of business development services for each vehicle is not transferable and shall be turned in to the department of business development services when the vehicle for which it was originally issued is deleted from the taxicab business. When a license is amended to add an additional vehicle, the appropriate information must be furnished, an additional license fee paid (if the addition of such vehicle would put the total number of vehicles operated by the taxicab business up into the next bracket), and when other requirements of this article are met, Macon-Bibb County may issue an additional numbered copy of the original taxicab business license. 
(c)  Each licensee hereunder shall also provide the department of business development services with proof that any new taxicab added to application is fully insured as required under this article. 
Sec. 27-30. - Identification; visibility. 
(a)  Each taxicab licensed to operate in Macon-Bibb County will have the name of the company clearly and permanently displayed on each of the two front doors, and also on both front and rear of the taxicab. Each taxicab shall also have its operating number clearly and permanently displayed on both sides and on the front and rear of the vehicle. The letters and numbers required in this section shall be a minimum of three and one-half inches in height. The numbered and non-transferable license tag issued by Macon-Bibb County is to be visibly displayed in the rear window or on the rear bumper of each taxicab. 
(b)  The rate schedule for fares to be charged shall be posted on the exterior of the taxicab, so as to be plainly visible to passengers entering the taxicab. Rates calculated by a meter, pursuant to section 27-36(c) shall be posted on a mile basis; rates calculated on a zoned rate pursuant to section 27-36(d) are not required to be posted on the exterior of the taxicab but shall be displayed as required by section 27-36(i). 
(c)  Each taxicab shall display a sign with the telephone number of Macon-Bibb County's customer service coordinator on the back of the driver's seat in a manner that is easily visible to passengers. The form and content of the sign shall be in accordance with specifications on file and available for public inspection at the department of business development services. 
Sec. 27-31. - Deviation from direct route unlawful. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful and also grounds for revocation of an operator's permit to proceed other than by the most practical and direct route to the destination of the passengers carried, unless specifically requested to follow another route by the passengers. 
(b)  The operator of each taxicab shall maintain in the taxicab a suitable map or street guide of Macon-Bibb County and shall make the same available to passengers upon request. 
Sec. 27-32. - Additional passengers. 
(a)  No additional person, other than the driver, shall be allowed to occupy any taxicab while picking up passengers except a driver trainee or those persons having written permission from the taxicab business. No additional passengers shall be picked up by any taxicab without the consent of the passengers first engaging transportation in the taxicab. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the operator of any taxicab to operate the taxicab with more than seven persons, exclusive of the driver. 
Sec. 27-33. - Fare disputes. 
(a)  Any fare dispute arising between any taxicab operator and any passenger shall be reported to the nearest available law enforcement officer who shall summon all disputing parties for appearance in the municipal court for a resolution of the dispute by the judge. 
(b)  The judge may find grounds to bind over the passenger for theft of services under state law or may suspend for up to 30 days the operator's permit issued hereunder for intentional overcharge or failure of consideration. If the operator has a history of intentional overcharge or failure of consideration, by having been in court for a fare dispute on two or more occasions within the 12-month period immediately preceding the current dispute, the judge may suspend the operator's permit issued hereunder for up to 90 days. 
(c)  The above-referenced penalties are intended to be inclusive only of the fare dispute, and either driver or passenger may be cited for additional Code or state law violations, as appropriate. 
Sec. 27-34. - Additional rules authorized. 
(a)  The mayor is fully authorized and empowered to adopt additional regulations respecting taxicabs, operators and drivers consistent with this Code and state law, and to designate, and from time to time change or eliminate, taxicab stands or parking areas. 
(b)  These additional regulations shall become effective after approval by the mayor and after being filed with the county clerk unless disapproved within 15 days of such filing by motion of the commission. 
(c)  The commission may, by resolution, amend these regulations at any time. 
Sec. 27-35. - License, permit revocation. 
Any license or permit issued under this article may be suspended or revoked by the municipal court upon a finding that any provision of this article has been violated or that the person or business holding the license or permit no longer meets the standards required for the issuance of the license or permit. 
Sec. 27-36. - Rates for taxicab fares. 
(a)  The maximum taxicab rates for Macon-Bibb County are hereby established, and it shall be a violation of this Code to charge more than the maximum amounts allowed hereunder. 
(b)  Meters. 
(1)  Every taxicab operating in Macon-Bibb County shall be equipped with a meter which shall accurately calibrate the distance traveled and calculate the fare charged to the passenger in accordance with the rate scale included in subsection (c), provided that any taxicab business licensed and operating in the City of Macon in 1988 shall be allowed to continue to calculate the fare using the zoned map and schedule of charges as set forth under subsection (d). 
(2)  The meter, once calibrated, shall be closed and sealed to prevent any tampering with the meter. No person shall operate a taxicab with a meter that is not properly sealed. 
(c)  A taxicab using a meter shall not charge more than $2.25 for the initial pickup of a passenger and the first one-tenth of a mile traveled by that passenger; for each additional one-tenth of a mile traveled by that passenger, there shall be charges not to exceed $0.15. 
(d)  For those taxicabs authorized to use the zoned map, the following definitions and rates shall apply: 
(1)  East Macon shall mean the area north/northeast across the Ocmulgee River from downtown, extended to the city limits of the City of Macon as they existed immediately prior to the commencement of the government of Macon-Bibb County. 
(2)  Vineville Area shall mean any area northwest of downtown bounded by Forsyth Street and Vineville Avenue on the west and the Ocmulgee River on the east, extended out to the city limits of the City of Macon as they existed immediately prior to the commencement of the government of Macon-Bibb County. 
(3)  West Macon shall mean any area west of downtown bounded on the east by Forsyth Street/Vineville and on the west by the Eisenhower Parkway and extended out to the city limits the City of Macon as they existed immediately prior to the commencement of the government of Macon-Bibb County. 
(4)  South Macon shall mean the area south/southwest of downtown Macon bounded on the north by Eisenhower Parkway and on the east by the Ocmulgee River extending out to the city limits the City of Macon as they existed immediately prior to the commencement of the government of Macon-Bibb County. 
(5)  Downtown shall mean the area bounded on the north by Riverside Drive, on the west by College Street, on the south by Oglethorpe Street, and on the east by Seventh Street. 
There shall be roughly concentric rings drawn and overlayed over the zones hereinbefore described, and a taxicab using this rate structure shall not be allowed to charge more than the amount specified in the accompanying schedule, per ring boundary/zone boundary traversed. 
(e)  In addition to the basic rates established in this section, these additional charges are hereby authorized: 
(1)  Grocery packages, each ..... N/C 
(2)  Large containers, each ..... N/C 
(3)  Overnight bags ..... N/C 
(4)  Suitcase, each ..... 0.25 
(5)  Footlocker, each ..... 1.25 
(6)  Passenger (additional): 
a.  Under 1 year old ..... N/C 
b.  1—6 years old, each ..... 0.50 
c.  7 years and above, each ..... 1.00 
(7)  Waiting time, per hour ..... 20.00 
(8)  Wheelchairs of handicapped passengers ..... N/C 
(f)  Nothing contained in this article shall prohibit agencies of the local, state or federal government from executing informal written contracts with taxicab companies for the transportation of their handicapped patients at the expense of the agency involved. A copy of the contract shall be filed in the county clerk's office. 
(g)  Nothing contained in this article shall obligate a taxicab operator to bodily lift a handicapped passenger into or from a taxicab. 
(h)  The two methods of calculating the basic charges are exclusive of one another, and any taxicab equipped with a meter shall charge by the use of the meter exclusively. 
(i)  Those taxicab businesses electing to use the zone map shall keep a certified copy of the map and a rate schedule prepared by Macon-Bibb County in each taxicab and make the same readily available to any passenger, upon request. 
Sec. 27-37. - Inspections by Macon-Bibb County. 
(a)  Annual inspections required. In addition to any other inspections required by law, each taxicab that require a license or permit to operate in Macon-Bibb County shall be subject to an annual inspection conducted by the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department. 
(b)  Inspection prior to issuance and renewal of license. Before a license required under this article is issued or renewed, the applicant shall deliver each taxicab listed in the license application to the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department for inspection to verify compliance with the provisions of this article. 
(c)  Random inspections. Throughout the year, each taxicab shall be subject to random inspections to verify compliance with the provisions of this article. Upon reasonable notice, the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department will notify the taxicab businesses to deliver the randomly selected taxicab(s) to the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department for inspection. Random inspections shall be free of charge. 
(d)  Inspection sticker. Each taxicab passing the annual inspection shall have affixed to the lower right rear windshield an inspection sticker issued by Macon-Bibb County. The inspection sticker shall indicate the date of the inspection and the number of the Macon-Bibb County-issued license tag. 
(e)  Correction slip. If a taxicab fails to pass inspection, the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department shall issue a correction slip to the operator, listing the items that need correction and showing the status of the inspection. The Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department shall forward a copy of the correction slip to the department of business development services and the taxicab business. The Macon-Bibb County license inspector may issue citations to the operator and the taxicab business for any deficiencies listed in the correction slip. 
(f)  Immediate hazard . If the items that need correction constitute an immediate hazard, the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department shall remove the previous inspection sticker, if any, and it shall be unlawful to operate the vehicle as a taxicab until it successfully passes inspection. Immediate hazards include, but are not limited to, the following deficiencies: 
(1)  Inoperable brake lights. (Section 27-39(b)). 
(2)  Inoperable door handle. (Section 27-40(a)). 
(3)  Inoperable turn signal. (Section 27-39(b)). 
(4)  Air conditioner does not cool (summer time). (Section 27-38(g)). 
(5)  Heater does not warm up (winter time). (Section 27-38(f)). 
(6)  Balding tires with thread showing. (Section 27-40(f)). 
(7)  Broken windshield. (Section 27-40(b)). 
(8)  No spare tire or jack in trunk. (Section 27-40(h)). 
(9)  Spare tire is balding with thread showing. (Section 27-40(h)). 
(10)  Excessive engine oil or other fluid leaks that may be a fire hazard. (Section 27-40(j)). 
(11)  Brake system deficiencies. (Section 27-40(c)). 
(12)  Excessive wear to suspension or steering components. (Section 27-40(e)). 
(g)  Other deficiencies. If the deficiencies in need of correction do not constitute an immediate hazard, the deficiencies shall be corrected and the taxicab shall be returned to the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department for re-inspection within 30 calendar days of the first inspection. Upon failure to correct the deficiencies and/or return the taxicab for re-inspection within the time limits stated, the previous inspection sticker, if any, shall be removed by the Macon-Bibb County vehicle maintenance department or the taxicab business, and it shall be unlawful to continue to operate the vehicle as a taxicab until it successfully passes inspection. 
(h)  Inspection fee. The fee for the annual inspection shall be $25.00 and shall be the responsibility of the taxicab business. An additional fee of $10.00 shall be charged for each required re-inspection. 
(i)  Failure to cooperate. Taxicab operators and taxicab businesses shall be prohibited from refusing to display to Macon-Bibb County license inspectors or law enforcement officers any information required by this article, and shall be prohibited from failing to cooperate with Macon-Bibb County license inspectors in performing their duties. 
(j)  Law enforcement officers. Nothing in this section shall be deemed to preclude sworn law enforcement officers from issuing citations for deficiencies or other violations of the law that are evident upon visual inspection. 
(k)  Responsibility for compliance. It shall be unlawful for any operator to drive or move, or for a taxicab business to cause or knowingly permit to be driven or moved, on any street or highway in Macon-Bibb County any taxicab that is in such unsafe condition as to endanger any person or that does not comply at all times with the requirements of sections 27-38, 27-39 and 27-40. 
Sec. 27-38. - Interior requirements. 
(a)  Rearview mirror. Every taxicab shall be equipped with an adjustable rearview mirror installed within the driver's compartment so as to enable the operator to obtain a reasonably clear view toward the rear. 
(b)  Upholstery. All upholstery covering in any taxicab shall be of leather or other nonabsorbent or washable material. 
(c)  Carpet and headliners. Carpet remnants cannot be used to cover holes. Dirty carpet must be cleaned; if cleaning does not remove spots, the carpet must be replaced. No staples or thumbtacks will be allowed to repair and/or replace headliners. Any holes in the carpet will require the carpet to be repaired or replaced. 
(d)  Tape. No tape or wire is allowed on any interior part of a taxicab to repair damages (e.g., seats, arm rests, dash board or headliners). 
(e)  Floor mats. Floor mats shall be provided of rubber or other washable material and shall at all times be removable. No taxicab shall have on the floor thereof any footrest, bracket or other fixture extending above the top of the floor mat. 
(f)  Heater. Every taxicab shall be equipped with a properly functioning heater sufficient to heat the interior of the cab adequately in cold weather. 
(g)  Air conditioner. Every taxicab shall be equipped with a properly functioning air conditioner sufficient to cool the interior of the cab adequately in hot weather. 
(h)  Passenger compartment light. Every taxicab shall be equipped with a passenger compartment light adequate to illuminate the interior of the passenger compartment. 
(i)  Litter. There shall be no litter in the vehicle or trunk. 
(j)  Cleaning. The interior of each taxicab shall be cleaned on a regular basis and a clean and sanitary appearance shall be maintained. 
(k)  Fire extinguisher. Every taxicab shall be equipped with a properly functioning fire extinguisher. 
Sec. 27-39. - Exterior requirements. 
(a)  Windshield wipers. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. § 40-8-73, every taxicab shall be equipped with double windshield wipers, properly installed and maintained at all times in good working order. 
(b)  Lights. No red light shall be visible from the front of any taxicab operating on the streets of Macon-Bibb County. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. §§ 40-8-22, 40-8-23, 40-8-25, and 40-8-26, every taxicab shall be equipped with two properly functioning headlights and standard rear lights so placed and constructed as to show a steady white light on the license plate sufficient to illuminate the figures thereon and render them discernible at night at a distance of 100 feet, and the view of such license plate shall at all times be unobstructed. Every taxicab shall be equipped with properly functioning taillights, brake lights, and directional signal lights. 
(c)  Grill. The grill must be in place and complete. 
(d)  Body. All exterior bodywork shall be maintained in good condition and free of tears and rust holes. No loose pieces such as fenders, bumpers or trim shall hang from the vehicle body. There shall be no body damage or any body condition that would create a safety problem or interfere with the operation of the vehicle. 
(e)  Paint. All exterior paintwork shall be maintained in good condition, free of substantial paint damage, chips and abrasions. Paint must be well blended with the natural configuration and color of the vehicle. Any repairs undertaken as a result of damage, that requires repainting the vehicle, or a portion of the vehicle, must be completed within 30 days of the damage to the vehicle. 
(f)  Glass. All windshield and window glass shall be maintained free from cracks, scratches, pitting, abrasions or any other conditions that significantly reduce clarity of vision. 
(g)  Cleaning. The exterior of each taxicab shall maintain a clean and sanitary appearance. 
Sec. 27-40. - General construction and equipment requirements. 
(a)  Doors. Each taxicab shall have properly functioning doors. All doors shall open from the inside and the outside with properly functioning door handles. 
(b)  Windshield and windows. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. §§ 40-8-73 and 40-8-78, the windshield and all windows in both the driver's compartment and the passenger compartment shall be of shatterproof safety glass and shall not be broken. Windows shall open and close properly. 
(c)  Brakes. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. §§ 40-8-50 through 40-8-54, all taxicabs shall be equipped with properly functioning four-wheel foot brakes. Foot brakes shall be so maintained as to operate upon all four wheels and shall be capable of stopping the vehicle within 22 feet at a speed of 20 miles per hour upon a smooth, dry roadway. All taxicabs shall be equipped with a parking brake, which shall operate upon the drive shaft or the rear wheels of the vehicle independently of the foot brakes. 
(d)  Bumpers. All taxicabs shall be equipped with bumpers, both front and rear. Front bumpers shall be in one solid piece, and rear bumpers may be of one or two pieces (bumperettes) securely fastened to the frame of the vehicle. 
(e)  Suspension components. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. § 40-8-6, all suspension components affecting the ride and safety of the vehicle shall be maintained such that they comply with the manufacturer's specifications. 
(f)  Tires and wheels. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. § 40-8-74, tires shall have a minimum tread of three-thirty-seconds. Wheels shall not be bent or damaged. All lug nuts shall be in tact. 
(g)  Speedometer. In addition to complying with the requirements of O.C.G.A. § 40-8-8, every taxicab shall be equipped with a standard speedometer properly installed, maintained in good working order and exposed to view. 
(h)  Spare tire, jack, lug wrench. Every taxicab shall be equipped with a jack, a lug wrench, and at least one spare tire, which shall at all times be kept inflated to the required pressure and meet the requirements of subsection (f). 
(i)  Trunk. The trunk shall be free of litter and have sufficient space for passengers' luggage. 
(j)  Fluid leaks. There shall be no leaks of engine oil or other fluids creating a fire hazard. 
Sec. 27-41. - Use of radios. 
It shall be unlawful to use a radio, compact disc player, tape player, or similar device if objected to by a passenger; provided, however, this section shall not prohibit the use of a radio used for receiving and transmitting messages from or to the office or headquarters of the taxicab business. 
Sec. 27-42. - Smoking prohibited. 
It shall be unlawful for any taxicab operator to smoke, or to permit any passenger to smoke, in a taxicab while such taxicab is transporting passengers. Smoking means inhaling, exhaling, burning or carrying any lighted cigar, cigarette, pipe or other smoking equipment in any manner or form. 
Sec. 27-43. - Enforcement. 
The general business license provisions of this Code, relating to regulated businesses generally, shall apply to the enforcement and administration of this article. 
Sec. 27-44. - Penalties. 
It shall be unlawful for any person operating a taxicab or taxicab business to do any of the acts forbidden by this article or to fail to do any of the acts required by this article. Violations of this article are punishable in accordance with the general penalty provisions of the code and are grounds for suspension and revocation of any license or permit issued under this article. 
Sec. 27-45. - Age limit of taxicabs. 
Any taxicab added to a taxicab fleet shall not be more than ten model years old. No taxicab licensed by Macon-Bibb County shall be older than ten model years. 
Sec. 27-46. - Taxicab advisory committee. 
The taxicab advisory committee which shall meet as needed, but no less than semi-annually to review complaints, and make recommendations to Macon-Bibb County for improvements in the taxicab industry. The taxicab advisory committee members shall be appointed for four year terms by the mayor and members of the taxicab advisory committee shall serve as members this committee without pay and compensation of any kind from Macon-Bibb County. At the initial meeting of the advisory committee, the committee shall elect a chairperson from among its members and may establish bylaws to govern its procedures. The taxicab advisory committee shall be comprised of the following seven members: 
(1)  A taxicab company owner headquartered within Macon-Bibb County; 
(2)  A taxicab operator who resides in Macon-Bibb County and who is not in the employment of the taxicab company owner on the taxicab advisory committee; 
(3)  A representative of the Macon-Bibb County convention and visitor's bureau; 
(4)  The mayor of Macon-Bibb County, or his or her designee; 
(5)  The chairperson of the public safety committee of the commission, or his or her designee; and 
(6)  Two independent citizens that use the taxicab business services. 
Upon the receipt of a written complaint, or proposed recommendations, the taxicab advisory committee shall convene within a reasonable time to hear the complaints or to receive recommendation. Decisions and recommendations of the committee shall be by majority vote. 
Secs. 27-47—27-55. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - WRECKERS 

Sec. 27-56. - Definition. 
The term "wrecker," as used in this article, means an automobile vehicle with hoisting apparatus and equipment for towing wrecked or disabled automobiles or other vehicles, or a tilt body truck with skids (skid truck) used to tow or carry disabled automobiles or other vehicles. The term "wrecker" also includes any vehicle otherwise equipped and used for purposes of towing or carrying wrecked or disabled automobiles or other vehicles. 
Sec. 27-57. - License required; application; exception. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person, either as principal, agent or employee, to use or operate upon any of the streets of Macon-Bibb County any wrecker, as defined in this article, without first having obtained a business license issued by Macon-Bibb County under and required by this article. 
(b)  Any person, either as principal, agent or employee, that owns a wrecker or wrecker service with a principal or branch office in Macon-Bibb County or which generates 50 percent of its gross income from business within Macon-Bibb County, shall be required to meet the business license application requirements generally, and shall also provide the sheriff with the make, model, manufacturer's serial number of the vehicle, the date the vehicle was put into service as a wrecker, and the driver's license number of all operators of the wrecker. The name and address of the insurance company with which the owner and all operators have liability insurance coverage with respect to the operation of the vehicle as required by law shall be filed with the county clerk. This section shall not apply to any person obtaining a wrecker to service its own private vehicles used in the operation of the business for which it is engaged, but lettering of said wrecker as set forth in section 27-58 shall be required. 
Sec. 27-58. - Lettering on vehicle. 
It shall be unlawful for any person, either as principal, agent or employee, to use or operate upon any street of Macon-Bibb County any wrecker, as defined in this article, unless the vehicle shall have lettered on each side in plain view the following information: 
(1)  The name of the person owning and causing the wrecker to operate on the streets of Macon-Bibb County shall be permanently printed in letters not less than four inches in height; 
(2)  The address from which the wrecker is operating; and 
(3)  The telephone number shall be in letters not less than two and one-half inches in height. This lettering shall be in a contrasting color to the color of the wrecker. 
Sec. 27-59. - Call to accident scene required; monitoring police radio unlawful; clearing of debris. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for the owner of any wrecker, his agent or employee, to go to any place where an accident has occurred for the purpose of picking up a disabled vehicle, unless called by the driver or the owner of the disabled vehicle, a law enforcement agency, or by the owner's authorized representative or employee. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the owner of any wrecker, his agent, representative or employee, to go to any place where an accident has occurred by reason of information received by a police radio. 
(c)  Prior to towing a vehicle from any site where an accident has occurred, the employee of a wrecker service shall clear the road surface of all broken glass and debris resulting from the accident. 
Sec. 27-60. - Solicitation of towing work prohibited—By vehicle driver or occupant. 
It shall be unlawful to drive along any Macon-Bibb County street or bridge and solicit towing work. Solicitation of towing work by the operator or the occupant of a wrecker while parked on any Macon-Bibb County street or bridge located within Macon-Bibb County is also prohibited. A wrecker operator shall not proceed to the scene of a disabled vehicle without having been requested or notified to do so. 
Sec. 27-61. - Same—By Macon-Bibb County employees. 
It shall be unlawful for any Macon-Bibb County employee to solicit business for any wrecker owner or operator. 
Sec. 27-62. - Revocation or suspension of license for article violations. 
Any license issued under this article may be suspended or revoked by the municipal court upon finding that any provision of this article has been violated or that the person or business holding the license no longer meets the standards required for the issuance of the license. 
Secs. 27-63—27-80. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE III. - HORSE-DRAWN VEHICLES 

Sec. 27-81. - Definitions. 
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
Horse-drawn vehicle means any vehicle which is operated or pulled by a horse which may be hired for the transportation of passengers and is operated within Macon-Bibb County. 
License means a business license issued under the general business license chapter of this Code and under this chapter. 
Permit means the grant by Macon-Bibb County to operate a horse-drawn vehicle upon the public streets of Macon-Bibb County. 
Sec. 27-82. - License required; application information; issuance. 
(a)  Every person desiring to own and operate a horse-drawn vehicle business within Macon-Bibb County or regularly carrying on the business of a horse-drawn vehicle service within Macon-Bibb County or on any Macon-Bibb County property outside Macon-Bibb County shall be required to have a business license issued by Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  A horse-drawn vehicle business seeking a license hereunder, in addition to meeting the business license application requirements generally, shall also provide the following information: 
(1)  The kind, make, and model of the vehicles to be used in the business, together with the safety and sanitation devices and methods to be employed. 
(2)  A certificate of compliance from the animal control director stating that the applicant meets all of the standards of the animal control division concerning horse-drawn carriages. 
(3)  An insurance certificate providing that the applicant has met the insurance requirements of this article. 
(4)  Any supplementary information Macon-Bibb County shall at any time demand in order to reasonably determine whether the request for a license should be granted. 
(c)  Upon submission of all required information and payment of all appropriate license fees and business taxes and meeting all requirements hereunder, Macon-Bibb County shall issue the horse-drawn vehicle license, numbered copies of which shall be displayed in all horse-drawn vehicles of the business as well as at the place of business. 
(d)  If Macon-Bibb County finds that the application is not in order or that the preconditions to the issuance of the license have not been met, Macon-Bibb County shall deny the horse-drawn vehicle license. 
Sec. 27-83. - Operator's permit. 
(a)  No person shall operate a horse-drawn vehicle upon the streets of Macon-Bibb County unless such person shall have first obtained a permit from Macon-Bibb County and been certified as to fitness to operate such horse-drawn vehicle by the sheriff. 
(b)  Applicants for a horse-drawn vehicle operator's permit shall register with Macon-Bibb County, furnishing name, address, a valid driver's license issued by the state, driver's license number, and a set of three photographs, and any other information Macon-Bibb County may require. Upon being fingerprinted by the sheriff and receiving approval by said department, the applicant may be issued a horse-drawn vehicle operator's permit upon payment of a fee. Such fee shall be an amount to be set as provided in the business license fee ordinance of Macon-Bibb County and such fee shall be payable annually upon renewal of such permit as required by this article. Such permit shall be displayed within the vehicle in plain view of passengers when the vehicle is in operation. 
(c)  No person shall be issued a permit to operate a horse-drawn vehicle in Macon-Bibb County who has been convicted, pled guilty or nolo contendere to an offense constituting a felony against the person of another within five years immediately preceding the application for such permit. 
(d)  No person shall be issued a permit to operate a horse-drawn vehicle in Macon-Bibb County if such person has been convicted, pled guilty or nolo contendere to any other felony within three years immediately preceding the application for such permit. 
(e)  Subsections (c) and (d) shall apply whether the offenses were committed within the state or elsewhere. 
Sec. 27-84. - Revocation. 
Any license or permit issued under this article may be suspended or revoked by the municipal court after affording the licensee or permittee notice of the charges and an opportunity to be heard. Upon a finding that any provision of this chapter has been violated by the licensee or permittee, his agent or employee, or that the business no longer meets the standard required for the issuance of the license, the municipal court may revoke the license in its entirety, suspend the same for a specified period of time, place the licensee on probation, or place other conditions thereon as the judge may deem necessary in addition to any other lawful punishment for violation of this Code. 
Sec. 27-85. - Compliance with traffic regulations. 
A permittee, having been issued a permit under this article to operate a horse-drawn vehicle, shall be subject to all traffic provisions of this Code, and all other traffic ordinances, rules and regulations of Macon-Bibb County and state. 
Sec. 27-86. - Liability insurance required. 
Every applicant for a horse-drawn vehicle business license shall, before the license is granted, deposit with Macon-Bibb County, for each vehicle for which the privilege to operate is sought, a policy or certificate of liability insurance, providing coverage for the applicant in the sum of at least the minimum amount of liability insurance for personal injury and property damage required by the state for motor vehicles. The certificate of policies of liability insurance shall be issued by a company or companies authorized to do business in the state. The certificate or policy of insurance shall identify all vehicles under the policy and shall contain a provision obligating the insurance company issuing such policy to give at least ten days written notice of cancellation or change of the policy to Macon-Bibb County. The license for the operation of the horse-drawn vehicle business shall expire upon the lapse, cancellation, termination or revocation of any policy or certificate of contract of insurance on any horse-drawn vehicle operated under the business. 
Sec. 27-87. - Violation of animal control division regulations. 
Any violation by the licensee of any regulation of the animal control division pertaining to horse-drawn carriages shall be considered a violation of this Code and punishable in the municipal court. 
Chapter 28 - TRAFFIC AND PARKING 
ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 28-1. - State law relative to operating motor vehicle without insurance adopted. 
O.C.G.A. § 36-32-7, dealing with operating a motor vehicle without insurance, is hereby adopted by reference as part of this Code, as if such code section were published in full herein. 
Sec. 28-2. - Vehicles to be marked; exceptions. 
(a)  All motor vehicles owned, leased or operated by Macon-Bibb County or any agency or department thereof shall display at all times upon the center of the exterior door surface (or in the case of four-door automobiles, upon the center of each front door surface) and upon each side thereof a decal in such form as shall from time to time be furnished by the manager and which shall show thereon the Macon-Bibb County seal so as to identify the motor vehicle as being one owned, leased or operated by Macon-Bibb County. Excepted from the provisions hereof, however, shall be motor vehicles used by the investigators of the county sheriff's office, four surveillance cars selected by the sheriff, the cars utilized by the drug squad, the cars operated by the sheriff and deputy sheriffs of civil court, one vehicle to be selected by the judge of the juvenile court used in the apprehension of juveniles, two vehicles used by the district attorney's office other than that assigned to the district attorney, and two vans used by the Bibb County Children's Home. 
(b)  Any person who shall operate a vehicle owned, leased or operated by Macon-Bibb County which does not display a decal with the provisions required by this section shall be guilty of an offense and, upon conviction thereof in the state court of the county, shall be punished as provided in the general penalty provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-3—28-10. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - TRAFFIC REGULATIONS 

Sec. 28-11. - Uniform rules of the road adopted. 
(a)  Adoption by reference. Pursuant to chapter 6 of title 40 of the Official Code of Gerogia Annotated, O.C.G.A. §§ 40-6-372 through 40-6-376, O.C.G.A. §§ 40-6-1 through 40-6-395 of that chapter known as the Uniform Rules of the Road and the definitions contained in O.C.G.A. § 40-1-1 are hereby adopted as and for the traffic regulations of Macon-Bibb County with like effect as if recited in this article. 
(b)  Penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided by law, every person convicted of a violation of any provision of this section shall be punished in accordance with the general penalty provisions of this Code unless otherwise provided by state law. 
Sec. 28-12. - Use of radar. 
(a)  Pursuant to the provisions of O.C.G.A. § 40-14-1 et seq., the commission, as the governing authority, does hereby approve of and desire the use of speed detection devices as such devices are defined in O.C.G.A. § 40-14-1. 
(b)  The commission does hereby authorize the sheriff to apply to the department of public safety for a permit to use such devices in accordance with the provisions of state law, and authorizes the sheriff to make such application in the name of and on behalf of the governing authority. Any act heretofore taken by the sheriff to that end is hereby ratified, confirmed and adopted as the action of the governing authority of Macon-Bibb County. 
(c)  As required by O.C.G.A. § 40-14-3, and in pursuance of the application for permit hereby authorized and ratified, there is attached (to the ordinance adopting this section, which ordinance is on file and available for inspection in the office of the clerk of the commission) as exhibit A a list of the streets and roads on which the device is to be used together with the indicated speed limits which have been approved by the division of traffic engineering and safety of the department of transportation of the state. 
Sec. 28-13. - Load limits which exceed 8,000 pounds prohibited. 
(a)  Trucks whose aggregate weight of vehicle and load exceeds 8,000 pounds are hereby prohibited from traveling on the following: 
(1)  Augusta Avenue, from Riggins Mill Road to Talmadge Drive; 
(2)  Brunswick Avenue, from Riggins Mill Road to Talmadge Drive; 
(3)  Cordele Avenue, from Riggins Mill Road to Talmadge Drive; 
(4)  Dana Drive, from Rainey Road W & SW to a Cul-de-sac; 
(5)  Decatur Avenue, from Riggins Mill Road to a dead end; 
(6)  Michael Drive, from Fulton Mill Road to Rogers Road; 
(7)  Talmadge Drive, from Augusta Avenue to Decatur Avenue. 
(b)  Any person, firm or corporation who shall violate the provisions of this section shall be deemed to be guilty of an offense and, upon conviction thereof in the state court of Macon-Bibb County shall be punished as provided in the general penalty provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-14. - Load limits which exceed 10,000 pounds prohibited. 
(a)  Trucks whose aggregate weight of vehicle and load exceeds 10,000 pounds are hereby prohibited from traveling on: 
Plaudit Road, from Knoxville Road to Bethel Church Road. 
(b)  Any person, firm or corporation who shall violate the provisions of this section shall be deemed to be guilty of an offense and, upon conviction thereof in the state court of Macon-Bibb County, shall be punished as provided in the general penalty provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-15. - Vehicle cover required. 
No person shall operate or load any vehicle on the public streets and roads of Macon-Bibb County unless the vehicle is constructed, loaded and securely covered so as to prevent any of its load from dropping, escaping or shifting in such a manner as to create a safety hazard or in such a manner so as to litter the streets and roads. 
Sec. 28-16. - Temporary traffic regulations. 
In cases where traffic upon the streets of Macon-Bibb County may become congested upon occasions of parades, at theaters and other public assemblages where large numbers of vehicles are assembled, the sheriff may make temporary rules directing and regulating the traffic in these congested districts, and any person, who, after being warned of the temporary traffic regulations, shall violate them shall be liable therefor as for other violations of this Code. 
Sec. 28-17. - Traffic, speed, truck, parking and other zones, signs and traffic-control devices. 
(a)  Upon adoption by resolution of the commission, the traffic engineer is authorized to designate and maintain by appropriate traffic-control signs, markings and devices after engineering and traffic investigations the following: 
(1)  Speed zones, provided Schedule IX shall remain in effect until new resolutions hereunder supersede it; 
(2)  Truck routes and streets to be designated specifically to prohibit various classes of trucks; 
(3)  One-way streets and other directional control devices; 
(4)  Stop signals and other traffic signals. 
(b)  The traffic engineer is authorized to issue written orders designating by appropriate traffic-control signs, markings and devices after engineering and traffic investigations the following: 
(1)  Pedestrian crosswalks; 
(2)  Other safety zones for pedestrians; 
(3)  Traffic lanes; 
(4)  Stop, yield and other right-of-way signs; 
(5)  Any other sign, marking or zone necessary for orderly and safe conditions on the streets of Macon-Bibb County. 
(c)  The traffic engineer shall maintain or cause to be recorded a current schedule of all traffic resolutions and orders under this section, which record shall be available for inspection by the public. 
(d)  All traffic-control signs, signals, devices and markings shall conform to specifications in the Manual on Uniform Traffic-Control Devices adopted by the state transportation board. All signs and signals required hereunder for a particular purpose shall so far as practicable be uniform as to type and location throughout Macon-Bibb County. All traffic-control devices so erected and not inconsistent with the provisions of state law or this Code shall be official traffic-control devices of Macon-Bibb County. All street name signs installed or replaced at street intersections after July 1, 2009, shall include the block number or house number range located on that section of road between intersections. 
(e)  Any violation of any traffic zone, marking, sign or other traffic-control device established pursuant to this section shall be a violation of this chapter. 
Sec. 28-18. - Speed regulations. 
(a)  State speed laws applicable. The state traffic laws regulating the speed of vehicles shall be applicable upon all roads and streets within Macon-Bibb County, except as this article, as authorized by state law, hereby declares and determines upon the basis of engineering and traffic investigation that certain speed regulations shall be applicable upon specified streets or in certain areas, in which event it shall be unlawful for any person to drive a vehicle at a speed in excess of any speed so declared in this section when signs are in place giving notice thereof. 
(b)  Increasing or decreasing state speed limits in certain zones. It is hereby determined upon the basis of an engineering and traffic investigation that the speed permitted by state law upon those streets or portions thereof described in Schedule IX is in need of adjustment for safe operation of vehicles thereon by reason of the designation and signposting of those streets as through highways, or by reason of widely spaced intersections or for other reasons, and it is hereby declared that the maximum speed limit upon those streets or portions thereof described in Schedule IX shall be as therein stated, which speeds so declared shall be effective at the time specified therein when signs are erected giving notice thereof. Schedule IX is hereby made a part hereof and the speed limits appearing on Schedule IX are hereby established as maximum speed limits. 
(c)  Regulation of speed by traffic signals. The traffic engineer is authorized to regulate the timing of traffic signals so as to permit the movement of traffic in an orderly and safe manner at speeds slightly at variance from the speeds otherwise applicable within Macon-Bibb County or at intersections and shall erect appropriate signs giving notice thereof. 
(d)  Minimum speeds on streets. It shall be unlawful for any person unnecessarily to drive at such slow speed as to impede or block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic, or between intersections at a speed less than fifteen (15) miles per hour. Other minimum speeds on roads and streets may be so designated by ordinance and marked by the traffic engineer consistent with the standards set out in subsection (a). 
(e)  Slowly moving vehicles. Slowly moving or heavily laden vehicles shall not be driven upon the streets abreast, but one (1) must follow behind the other and keep as near the right curb as possible. 
(f)  Driving past individuals working on streets. The maximum rate of speed shall be no higher than reasonable and safe when approaching or driving past individuals working in the street, who are Macon-Bibb County employees, public utility employees, or those granted permission of the government to work in the street, provided such site is marked in accordance with the specifications of the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices. 
(g)  Blanket speed zones: 
(1)  The maximum lawful speed for any person to drive in the central business district or on residential streets that are not boulevard roadways will be twenty-five (25) miles per hour unless signs are erected displaying other messages and the signs are a result of a proper engineering and traffic investigation and are otherwise a result of an authorized reduction in speed limit. The maximum speed limit on all other roads and streets within Macon-Bibb County shall be thirty-five (35) miles per hour unless a different speed is established in this article or except where a street is listed on Schedule IX with a different maximum speed, in which case the maximum speed shall be that indicated in this article or shown on Schedule IX and such different maximum speed limit shall be posted. 
(2)  No vehicle shall be operated at a rate of speed in excess of twenty-five (25) miles per hour upon entering and traversing school areas and school crossings between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 9:15 a.m., and between the hours of 2:00 p.m. and 3:30 p.m., and at such other times as children are assembling at and departing from the schools, on the days the schools are in session. The special speed limit here established for school areas and school crossings shall apply to all school areas and school crossings in Macon-Bibb County, except where a different speed limit for school areas and school crossings have been determined on the basis of an engineering and traffic investigation and included in Schedule IX, in which case the speed limit in Schedule IX shall be applicable and such different speed limit shall be posted. 
(3)  School areas and school crossings are defined as those sections of streets between signs or markers designating the same as school areas or school crossings, placed in the center of the streets, painted thereon, or erected at the side of the streets. The signs or markers shall clearly indicate the existence of such school areas and school crossings and shall be plainly visible to vehicle operators during applicable hours. During all hours and upon all days other than those specified in this section, vehicular travel at the maximum applicable legal speed shall be permitted in school areas or school crossings. 
(h)  Speed limits at airport. It shall be unlawful for any vehicle to maintain a speed of more than twenty-five (25) miles per hour upon any roads in or upon any municipal airport. 
(i)  [Reserved.] 
(j)  Schedule IX on file. A copy of the current Schedule IX shall at all times be kept on file in the office of the clerk of Macon-Bibb County and available for public inspection.

Sec. 28-20. - Permitting another to drive vehicle while under the influence of intoxicants or drugs. 
It shall be unlawful for any person who is the owner of any vehicle or who is in possession of any vehicle, whether lawfully or not, to permit or procure any other person to drive or operate any such vehicle within Macon-Bibb County while the other person is under the influence of alcoholic beverages or while under the influence of illegal drugs. 
Sec. 28-21. - Skating and coasting in street. 
It shall be unlawful for any person upon roller skates, or riding in or by means of any coaster or similar toy vehicle, except bicycles, to go upon any roadway except while crossing the street on a crosswalk. 
Sec. 28-22. - U-turns prohibited. 
The operator of a vehicle shall not reverse the direction in which such vehicle is proceeding by making a turn, commonly known as a U-turn, upon any street of Macon-Bibb County, whether at or between intersections; provided, however, that this section shall not be construed to prohibit reversing direction by turning through parkways and around monuments where such turns are safely permitted. 
Sec. 28-23. - Use of horns. 
The blowing of horns, except as a warning to pedestrians or operators of other vehicles, is prohibited. 
Sec. 28-24. - Types of horns. 
All motor vehicles must be equipped with warning horns of only standard types such as are placed thereon by motor vehicle dealers and manufacturers. Horns operated by the exhaust of an engine are prohibited. This section shall not apply to ambulances and to motor driven equipment used by the police and fire departments. 
Sec. 28-25. - Passenger space. 
It shall be unlawful to ride on any vehicle upon any portion thereof not designed or intended for the use of passengers when the vehicle is in motion. This provision shall not apply to an employee engaged in the necessary discharge of his or her duty, or within truck bodies in space intended for merchandise. 
Sec. 28-26. - Display of lighted back-up lights unlawful. 
It shall be unlawful at any time and at any place in Macon-Bibb County for the operator of any motor vehicle to display lighted back-up lights or other white light on the rear of the vehicle when it is moving in a forward direction. 
Sec. 28-27. - Center left turn lanes. 
Traffic lanes designated in both directions by left turn arrows for both directions of traffic shall be used for prompt deceleration and left turns only. No person shall drive any vehicle in these lanes for a longer distance than is reasonably necessary to decelerate from the through traffic lane and promptly turn left at the first convenient drive, street or entrance. 
Sec. 28-28. - Truck route limitations.
