(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to operate or drive, or cause to be operated or driven, or otherwise bring any motor vehicle having a gross weight, including cargo, in excess of eight thousand (8,000) pounds upon any street or portion of a street where signs are posted prohibiting vehicles having such weight, except as provided in subsection (b). 
(b)  The prohibition in subsection (a) shall not apply if the vehicle is travelling to or from a location in the prohibited area to pick up cargo, deliver cargo, or perform a service at said location. 
(c)  Upon request, the driver of a vehicle as described in subsection (a) shall present to law enforcement officers the driver's log books, delivery slips and other written evidence of the driver's destination and the point of origin to justify, under subsection (b), the presence of the truck on a street or portion of street from which the truck would otherwise be prohibited by this section. 
(d)  A violation of the prohibition contained in subsection (a) shall be punishable by a minimum $50.00 fine in addition to any other punishment which may be imposed by municipal court. 
(e)  The Macon-Bibb County traffic engineer is authorized and directed to designate the streets and portions of streets to be covered by the prohibition contained in subsection (a) and to order the posting of appropriate signs. The traffic engineer shall make such designations based upon safety, congestion, business operations, noise, fumes, and other similar considerations. Notice of a designation shall be forwarded to members of commission through the clerk of commission and shall become effective 30 days following such notice unless during said period the commission, on motion, second, and majority vote, rejects the designation. All streets and portions of streets where such signs existed on October 1, 2001, shall be deemed automatically designated for the purposes of this section. 
Sec. 28-29. - Driving across private property to avoid an intersection. 
It shall be unlawful for the driver of any motorized vehicle to drive such vehicle across the private property of another, when the driver of such vehicle has no intention to stop for the purpose of carrying on business, personal or otherwise, so as to avoid entering any intersection as defined in this Code. 
Sec. 28-30. - Bicycle routes established. 
Bicycle paths or sidewalks shall be established along or near those streets as listed in the bike route street inventory, which is hereby incorporated herein and made a part of this Code by reference, a copy of which shall be maintained on file in the office of the clerk of the commission and in the office of the traffic engineer, which shall be used by bicycle riders as required by O.C.G.A. § 40-6-294, as now enacted or hereafter amended. Such paths or sidewalks shall be identified by appropriate signs and if consisting of part of any street or sidewalk shall be delineated to permit identification of that portion of the street or sidewalk which shall be designated as the bicycle lane of traffic. 
Sec. 28-31. - Riding bicycle on sidewalks in business district prohibited. 
(a)  No person shall ride a bicycle upon a sidewalk within the central business district, unless such sidewalk shall be designated as a portion of the bike route. The central business district shall be as follows: 
Fifth Street from Riverside Drive to Oglethorpe Street (including that portion of Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard from Walnut Street to Mulberry Street); Oglethorpe Street from Fifth Street to First Street; First Street from Oglethorpe Street to Riverside Drive; Riverside Drive from First Street to Fifth Street. 
(b)  In addition to the bicycle route established in section 28-41, all city sidewalks not included in the central business district are hereby designated as bicycle routes for all persons ten (10) years of age or under. 
(c)  Any person who is riding a bicycle upon a sidewalk shall yield the right-of-way to any pedestrian. 
(d)  Notwithstanding the provisions of section 28-41 and 28-42, subsections (a), (b) and (c), the Macon police department bicycle patrol shall be authorized to operate their bicycles on any city sidewalk to enforce all local, state and federal laws. 
Sec. 28-32. - Persons in wheelchairs and powered mobility devices shall be treated as pedestrians. 
(a)  Within Macon-Bibb County, for the purpose of traffic control and the duties and responsibilities for all persons using parts of the Macon-Bibb County or state street or highway systems, persons in wheelchairs and in powered mobility devices shall be treated as pedestrians with all the rights and duties established by article 5, Pedestrians, of the Uniform Rules of the Road, codified at O.C.G.A. § 40-6-90 et seq. 
(b)  Provided that pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 40-6-320, it shall not be a violation of this section for a person using an electric personal assistive mobility device or a powered mobility device from operating such a device on a roadway with a speed limit of thirty-five (35) miles per hour or less, or in a separately striped bicycle lane, in the same direction of travel authorized for motor vehicle traffic on that roadway. 
Sec. 28-33. - Specific rights and duties of persons in wheelchairs and powered mobility devices. 
(a)  A person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device shall obey the instructions of any official traffic-control device specifically applicable to him, unless otherwise directed by a law enforcement officer. 
(b)  A person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device shall be subject to traffic and pedestrian control signals as provided by O.C.G.A. §§ 40-6-21 and 40-6-22. 
(c)  At all other places, persons in wheelchairs shall be accorded the privileges and shall be subject to the restrictions for pedestrians stated in O.C.G.A. tit. 40, ch. 5. 
(d)  Persons in wheelchairs or a powered mobility device shall be subject to the same rights and duties as any pedestrian crossing a roadway in a crosswalk as established in O.C.G.A. § 40-6-91. 
(e)  Persons in wheelchairs or a powered mobility device shall be subject to the same rights and duties as any pedestrian crossing a roadway outside a crosswalk as established in O.C.G.A. § 40-6-92. 
(f)  Notwithstanding other provisions of this Chapter, every driver of a vehicle shall exercise due care to avoid colliding with any person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device, shall give warning by sounding a horn when necessary, and shall exercise proper precautions upon observing any person in a wheelchair/powered mobility device in or crossing a roadway. 
(g)  A person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device shall yield to authorized emergency vehicles making use of audible and/or visual signals as any other pedestrian is required to pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 40-6-99. 
Sec. 28-34. - Persons in wheelchairs and powered mobility devices on or along roadways. 
(a)  Where a sidewalk is provided, it shall be unlawful for any person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device to stand or move along and upon an adjacent roadway unless there is no motor vehicle traveling within 1,000 feet of such person in a wheelchair on such roadway or the available sidewalk presents an imminent threat of injury to such person in a wheelchair. 
(b)  Where a sidewalk is not provided but a shoulder is available and capable of allowing passage by the person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device, any person in a wheelchair/powered mobility device standing or moving along and upon a roadway shall stand or move only on the shoulder, as far as practicable from the edge of the roadway. 
(c)  Where neither a sidewalk nor a shoulder is available, any person in a wheelchair or powered mobility device standing or moving along and upon a roadway shall stand or move as near as practicable to an outside edge of the roadway, and if on a two-lane roadway, shall stand or move only on the left side of the roadway. 
(d)  Except as otherwise provided by this chapter, a person in a wheelchair or a powered mobility device upon a roadway shall yield the right-of-way to all vehicles upon the roadway. 
Secs. 28-35—28-65. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE III. - PARKING 
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 28-66. - Loading, unloading and no parking zones. 
(a)  The following designated zones for loading and unloading of freight or passengers or both, and for no parking are established in the manner provided in this section. 
(1)  Standard freight loading zones, which shall be identified by a red boundary stripe and appropriately marked by signs. The parking, standing or stopping of vehicles in these zones for periods specified on the signs is prohibited, except as follows: The parking, standing or stopping of clearly marked and identified commercial vehicles shall be permitted in these zones for the purpose of expeditiously loading and unloading their cargoes; provided, however, that in no event shall the continuous parking, stopping or standing of the vehicles in these zones exceed a period of one (1) hour. 
(2)  Passenger loading zones, which shall be identified by a yellow stripe and appropriately marked by signs. The parking, standing or stopping of vehicles in these zones is prohibited, except for the purpose of expeditiously loading and unloading passengers and baggage, and in no event shall any vehicle be left in the zone unattended by a driver. 
(3)  Bus loading zones, which shall be identified by a yellow stripe and appropriately marked by signs. The parking, standing or stopping of any vehicle in this zone other than a commercial passenger bus is prohibited. The parking, standing or stopping of commercial passenger buses shall be permitted in these zones only for the purpose of expeditiously loading and unloading passengers, and in no event shall any such vehicle be left in the zone unattended by a driver. 
(4)  Taxicab or public drayage stands, which shall be identified by a yellow stripe and appropriately marked by signs. The parking, standing or stopping of any vehicle in this zone other than a licensed taxicab or public dray is prohibited. 
(5)  No parking zones shall be identified by a yellow curbline or appropriate signs or both. The parking, standing or stopping of any vehicle in these zones identified only by yellow curblines is prohibited, except that a taxicab licensed by Macon-Bibb County may stop in these zones for a period not to exceed three (3) minutes for the sole purpose of taking on or discharging a passenger, provided that the cab motor continues operating and the driver is in close proximity to the cab and if requested by any law enforcement or fire officer to move the cab, the taxicab driver promptly does so. The parking, standing or stopping of any vehicle in these zones identified by appropriate signs shall be prohibited only during the hours specified on appropriate signs. 
(b)  The traffic engineer, or persons at his direction, shall, from time to time, establish the zones designated and described in this article upon streets of Macon-Bibb County as traffic conditions may require and order the erection of the proper signs and markings or the painting of boundary stripes and curblines. 
Sec. 28-67. - Parking in white lines. 
On streets within Macon-Bibb County where white lines are shown for guidance, parking must conform to the lines and vehicles must be entirely within the boundaries designated by the lines. These markings shall be done by the traffic-control department as provided in this article. In residential sections of Macon-Bibb County, all vehicles must park parallel to the curb, except where the white lines indicate a different method of parking. 
Sec. 28-68. - Double parking; permits. 
(a)  No vehicles shall stand abreast, alongside of or lapping each other in any street in that area of Macon-Bibb County which was formerly located in the City of Macon. The method of parking herein prohibited is commonly known as double parking. 
(b)  The provisions of subsection (a) shall not apply to the downtown area of the city, which, for the purposes of this section, is defined as being Mulberry Street, Cherry Street and Poplar Street from First to Fifth Street, inclusively; Second Street, Third Street and Broadway from Plum Street to Mulberry Street, inclusively; and Cotton Avenue from Poplar Street to Mulberry Street. Within the downtown area as defined in this section, double-parking shall be permitted from 7:00 p.m. until 7:30 a.m. of each day, including Saturday. Double-parking shall be permitted from 9:00 a.m. each day including Saturdays until 4:00 p.m. All trucks shall load or unload parallel to the curb and as near to the curb as possible. This section shall not authorize double-parking if a parking space is available at the curb. No vehicle shall double-park nearer than one hundred (100) feet to another vehicle which may be double-parked across the street. 
(c)  Permits may be issued by the sheriff authorizing double parking within the limits specified in this section as to time and area, to persons operating trucks for the purpose of receiving or delivering freight, express or merchandise in the downtown area as defined in this article, provided the sheriff shall first find as a fact that such double parking is necessary to the conduct of the business of the person and that no other reasonable means of conduct of the business is available. 
Sec. 28-69. - Unattended vehicles. 
No person having control of a motor vehicle shall allow the vehicle to stand on any street unattended without first setting the brakes thereon and stopping the motor of the vehicle and, when standing upon a perceptible grade, without turning the wheels of the vehicle into the curb or side of the street or highway. 
Sec. 28-70. - Parking at crossings. 
The parking of vehicles shall not be permitted at crossings between streets and parks, unless such parking is authorized by white lines shown on the pavement. 
Sec. 28-71. - Parking in alleys; defined. 
(a)  The parking, standing or stopping of vehicles, except as provided in this article, in any alley in that area of Macon-Bibb County formerly located within the City of Macon is hereby prohibited. 
(1)  Vehicles which are clearly designated as commercial vehicles and which are at the time being used for commercial purposes shall be permitted to park, stand or be stopped in alleys which are wide enough to leave available not less than ten (10) feet of the width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic, for such time only as is necessary to load or unload their respective cargoes; provided, however, that no such vehicles shall be parked so as to block an intersection, doorway or driveway, nearer than fifty (50) feet in front of or behind another vehicle already parked on the opposite side of the alley. 
(2)  Vehicles which are clearly designated as commercial vehicles and which are at the time being used for commercial purposes shall be permitted to stand and be stopped in alleys which are so narrow that the standing or stopping of such vehicle therein leaves less than ten (10) feet of the width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic, for such time only as is necessary to load and unload their respective cargoes, provided that no such vehicle shall be so stopped as to block an intersection, doorway or driveway, and provided that an operator shall remain in such vehicle at all times and shall move such vehicle immediately when necessary to permit the passage through such alley of any law enforcement, fire or ambulance vehicles. 
(b)  An alley shall be defined as a street intended to provide access to the rear or side of a building in urban areas and not primarily for through traffic. 
Sec. 28-72. - Right-of-way while parking. 
The operator of any vehicle in the process of backing into a parallel parking space or a back-in only angled parking space shall have the right-of-way over the operator of any other vehicle attempting to enter such parking space. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0003, § 1, 1-20-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-73. - Relative rights of vehicles to single parallel parking spaces and back-in only angled parking spaces. 
(a)  Whenever the operator of a vehicle is desirous of occupying a parallel parking space which is about to be vacated, the person shall place the vehicle in a position in the lane nearest to the space desired, with the front of the vehicle to the rear of the vehicle vacating the parallel parking space. The person shall hold this position until the parking space is vacated, after which, remaining in the same lane, the driver of such vehicle shall pull forward a sufficient distance to enable the vehicle to occupy the parking space by backing into the same. While backing in the process of parking, the driver of the vehicle shall have the right-of-way prescribed in this Code. 
(b)  Whenever the operator of a vehicle is desirous of occupying a back-in only angled parking space which is about to be vacated, the person shall place the vehicle in a position in the lane nearest to the space desired, with the front of the vehicle to the left of the vehicle vacating the back-in only angled parking space. The person shall hold this position until the parking space is vacated, after which, remaining in the same lane, the driver of such vehicle shall pull forward a sufficient distance to enable the vehicle to occupy the parking space by backing into the same. While backing in the process of parking, the driver of the vehicle shall have the right-of-way prescribed in this Code. 
(c)  The right-of-way and procedure for occupying a single space which is already vacant shall be the same as that hereinabove prescribed, except that it shall not be necessary for an operator to bring the vehicle to a halt in the rear of the space to be occupied. 
(d)  This section shall not apply to parking spaces immediately adjacent to street or alley intersections. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0003, § 2, 1-20-2015 ) 
Editor's note— Ord. No. O-15-0003, § 2, adopted January 20, 2015, amended the title of § 28-73 to read as set out herein. Previously § 28-73 was titled relative rights of vehicles to single parallel parking spaces. 
Sec. 28-74. - Fireplugs and intersections. 
No vehicle shall be parked within ten (10) feet of a fire hydrant, nor within twenty (20) feet of the intersection of curblines, or, if none, then within ten feet of the intersection of the roadway edges at an intersection, except at an alley. 
Sec. 28-75. - Blocking another vehicle. 
No vehicle shall be parked or stopped in such a position as to prevent convenient movement of another vehicle already stopped. 
Sec. 28-76. - On sidewalks or blocking driveways. 
No vehicle shall be parked in a manner to prevent convenient access to a private driveway or on a sidewalk. 
Sec. 28-77. - Near obstructions. 
No vehicle shall be parked alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such stopping, standing or parking would obstruct traffic. 
Sec. 28-78. - Use of parking space for business and repairs. 
Garages, filling stations, repair shops, transit lines or other such places of business shall not use the streets for parking vehicles for more than sixty (60) minutes, day or night, and all work done on vehicles must be carried on inside the premises, and no vehicle shall be kept on the sidewalk. 
Sec. 28-79. - Area reserved for use of county vehicles of sheriff's department. 
The area along the curb northwest of Second Street running from Mulberry Street to Walnut Street Lane is hereby designated as a parking zone for the exclusive use of official vehicles owned by Macon-Bibb County operated by the sheriff of the county and the sheriff of the civil court of the county, and it shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle, other than official vehicles operated by the sheriff of the county or by the sheriff of the civil court of the county, in that area. The traffic engineer shall have the power and authority to prescribe and designate the signs to be used to indicate said zoned area. 
Sec. 28-80. - In housing project. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any motor vehicle or any other vehicle in or on the roads or highways through or in any of the projects of the Oglethorpe Homes, Tindall Heights Homes, or Bowden Homes or any other place therein, except parking areas designated by the traffic engineer where such vehicles may be parked. 
Sec. 28-81. - Owner or operator responsible. 
In all cases where the vehicle is illegally parked by an agent or the representative of the owner or person having at the time actual or constructive possession and control of such vehicle, the owner or person having such possession and control shall be deemed to be guilty of such violation. 
Sec. 28-82. - Maximum parking time on streets. 
No vehicle shall remain parked on any streets within Macon-Bibb County longer than seventy-two (72) hours consecutively. Vehicles so parked shall be impounded. 
Sec. 28-83. - Parking on Macon-Bibb County property. 
The mayor is hereby authorized to regulate parking on any property owned or leased by Macon-Bibb County by executive order or administrative policy statement and it shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle or other equipment on property owned or leased by Macon-Bibb County except in accordance with the mayor's regulations and except as designated by signs or painted on the pavement. 
Sec. 28-84. - One-hour parking restrictions; exceptions. 
(a)  (1)  No person shall park or allow to stand any bus, truck or other freight or passenger-carrying vehicle in excess of one (1) ton capacity, upon any street or highway located in a residential zone within that area of Macon-Bibb County formerly located within the City of Macon for a period of longer than one (1) hour at a time during the day or night, except when actively loading or unloading goods or passengers. 
(2)  No person shall park or allow to stand any bus, truck or other freight or passenger-carrying vehicle in excess of 10,000 pounds, upon any street or highway located in a residential zone within that area of Macon-Bibb County formerly located within unincorporated Bibb County for a period of longer than one hour at a time during the day or night, except when actively loading or unloading goods or passengers. 
(b)  No person shall park or stand any camper trailer, motor home, boat or boat trailer on any residential street or public place for more than one (1) hour at any time during the day or night. 
(c)  No person shall park or allow to stand any truck or trailer designed or used to transport petroleum products or other flammable or explosive material on any residential street, unless such vehicle is making a delivery at the address where it is parked, or it is disabled, provided that in either event, such vehicle shall be removed from such residential street within one (1) hour. No vehicle described in this subsection shall be operated upon any residential street unless such street is a state or federal highway or a direct connector to a commercial area in which the vehicle's destination is situated, or unless a delivery is being made on such residential street. No vehicle described in this subsection shall be parked or allowed to stand on any private property zoned for residential use, unless a delivery is being made at the address where the vehicle is being parked. If a delivery is being made it shall be completed and the vehicle shall be removed from such zoned residential area within one (1) hour. 
(d)  Any vehicle in violation of this section, which remains parked in violation of this section for a period of seventy-two (72) hours or more, shall be presumed to be abandoned and may be impounded by the sheriff. 
(e)  No person shall park or allow to stand any vehicle described in this section when such vehicle is parked or standing on any street zoned commercial if parked or standing within five hundred (500) feet of a public or private elementary or secondary school or school grounds, except when actively loading or unloading goods or passengers. 
(f)  A violation of this section shall be punishable by a minimum fifty dollar ($50.00) fine in addition to any other punishment the municipal court may impose. 
(g)  The provisions of this section shall not apply to work crews engaged in street repairs or emergency utility repairs. 
Sec. 28-85. - Parking on roads and streets in former unincorporated area. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park a motor vehicle within the right-of-way of the public roads or streets of Macon-Bibb County outside the limits of any current or former incorporated areas therein unless every part of such motor vehicle is a minimum of 18 feet from the centerline of the pavement on said roads or streets; or if there is no pavement, within 18 feet of the centerline of the traveled portion of such road or street. 
Sec. 28-86. - Parking on certain segment of State Route 11 prohibited. 
It shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicle within the right-of-way of State Route 11 on each side thereof beginning at mile post 2.80 in the area that was formerly unincorporated Bibb County, and continuing north for a distance of 1,000 feet to mile post 3.00, a distance of 0.20 miles. The prohibition contained in this section shall be deemed to prohibit parking on the above-described segment at any time. 
Sec. 28-87. - No parking on Lawrence Drive South. 
(a)  All vehicles shall be prohibited from parking on Lawrence Drive South from School Road to its end. 
(b)  Any person violating this section shall be guilty of an offense, and upon conviction shall be punished as provided in the general penalty provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-88. - Further regulations respecting parking on certain roads and streets. 
(a)  Whenever the Macon-Bibb County traffic engineer, after investigation, determines it to be in the best interests of the government and the public to regulate or prohibit the parking of motor vehicles on the rights-of-way of county streets and roads or segments thereof in that area of Macon-Bibb County that was formerly unincorporated Bibb County, he shall be authorized to record his findings and conclusions and to issue a work order directing that appropriate signage mark the roads and street or segments thereof at each end of such road or street or segment thereof as to which he makes such determination. 
(b)  The Macon-Bibb County traffic engineer shall forthwith forward to the mayor and each commissioner a copy of the determination so made and shall hold in abeyance the erection of signs prescribed above for a period of 30 days. 
(c)  If the governing body of Macon-Bibb County fails during such 30-day period to disapprove or to modify the action of the traffic engineer, the conclusions and findings of the traffic engineer shall be deemed to have been adopted, ratified and confirmed as the action of the governing body and the same shall become effective for all purposes. 
(d)  The parking of motor vehicles on streets or roads or segments thereof which are marked as no parking areas shall be prohibited and any such parking shall be deemed to be a violation of this section. 
(e)  At the expiration of such 30-day period, if the governing body of Macon-Bibb County has not disapproved or modified the findings of the traffic engineer, this section shall be of full force and effect and a violation thereof shall be punishable as provided in the general penalty provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-89. - Fines. 
(a)  Overtime parking in violation of any section of this article except section 28-84 shall be punishable by a ten dollar ($10.00) fine. 
(b)  The fee for any overtime parking ticket not paid within twenty (20) days from the date that it is issued shall be increased to thirty dollars ($30.00). 
(c)  Any vehicle parked in a metered or time-controlled parking space governed by article III with one hundred dollars ($100.00) or more in unpaid overtime parking fines shall be immobilized in accordance with the procedures set forth in section 28-93. 
Sec. 28-90. - Illegal use of notice or summons. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person, after incurring a violation of any of the provisions of this article, to display, at a time controlled parking space or location upon the streets of Macon-Bibb County different from the space or location at which the violation was incurred, upon the windshield or other exterior portion of the vehicle involved in the violation, or upon the windshield or other exterior portion of any other vehicle, the official parking violation notice or summons of the municipal court placed upon the vehicle involved in the violation by deputy sheriff, whether the notice or summons be so displayed at such different space or location on the date of the issuance of the notice or summons or on a date subsequent thereto. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for any person to remove any official parking violation notice or summons, or any other official notice or summons of the municipal court, from the exterior or interior of any vehicle not owned by that person or not in his legal possession, unless he or she is duly authorized by the owner or person in legal possession of the vehicle to remove it. 
(c)  It shall be unlawful for any person to display, affix or to place upon any portion of the exterior of any vehicle parked at any location in Macon-Bibb County, any official parking violation notice or summons, or any other official notice or summons of the municipal court which has not been issued by an employee of the office of the sheriff. Possession by any unauthorized person of any such official notice or summons, which has not been issued by an authorized member of the office of the sheriff, shall be unlawful. 
Sec. 28-91. - Service of summons when driver of illegally parked vehicle is present. 
When any driver is found with a motor vehicle parked or stopped in violation of any overtime parking provision of article III, the sheriff or any law enforcement officer designated to give such parking violation notices as part of their official duties, finding such vehicle, shall take the name, address and driver's license number of the alleged violator and the registration number of the motor vehicle involved and shall issue in writing and serve personally upon the violator a notice and summons, which shall include: 
(1)  The date and time of the violation, 
(2)  The location of the violation, 
(3)  The amount of the fine, 
(4)  The date by which the fine shall be paid, and 
(5)  The manner and time in which the violation may be contested in court. 
Sec. 28-92. - Notice affixed to illegally parked vehicle. 
(a)  When any motor vehicle without driver is found stopped or parked in violation of any overtime parking provision of article III, any law enforcement office designated to give such parking violation notices as part of their official duties, finding such vehicle, shall take its registration number and may take any other information displayed on the vehicle which may identify its user, and shall conspicuously affix to such vehicle a notice and summons, which shall include: 
(1)  The date and time of the violation, 
(2)  The location of the violation, 
(3)  The amount of the fine, 
(4)  The date by which the fine shall be paid, and 
(5)  The manner and time in which the violation may be contested in court. 
(b)  If the violator does not respond to the notice and summons within the five (5) day period set in such notice and summons by either paying the fine or appearing before the municipal court to contest the charges, the municipal court clerk shall send a second notice and summons by certified mail to the registered owner of the vehicle to which the first notice and summons were affixed. If the violator does not respond to the second notice and summons within fifteen (15) days of the date the notice and summons were issued by either paying the fine or appearing before the municipal court to contest the charges, the fine for the violation shall become twenty dollars ($20.00). 
(c)  If at any time the number of violations and unpaid fines total one hundred dollars ($100.00), the vehicle which is the subject of the violations may be subject to immobilization. The violator has the right at any time specified in the notice and summons to pay the fine or appear before the municipal court to contest the charges. 
Sec. 28-93. - Immobilization of vehicle. 
(a)  If any vehicle is found parked in violation of section 28-89(c), officers of the office of the sheriff are authorized to temporarily and for a period of forty-eight (48) hours, immobilize such vehicle by installing on, or attaching to such vehicle, a device designed to restrict the normal movement of such vehicle. 
(b)  If such vehicle is so immobilized, the deputy so installing or attaching such device shall conspicuously affix to such vehicle a notice, in writing, on a form provided by the sheriff, which shall advise the owner, driver or person in charge of such vehicle that: 
(1)  Such vehicle has been immobilized by Macon-Bibb County for violating section 28-89(c), 
(2)  The date and time of the violation, 
(3)  The location of the violation, 
(4)  The violation of section 28-89(c) and immobilization may be contested in municipal court within forty-eight (48) hours, 
(5)  Release from such immobilization may be obtained at the municipal court by paying a twenty-five dollar ($25.00) immobilization fee and all unpaid overtime parking fines within forty-eight (48) hours, 
(6)  If the vehicle is not released within forty-eight (48) hours, the vehicle will be removed from the streets to the city impound lot at the violator's expense, and 
(7)  Removing or attempting to remove the device before a release is obtained is unlawful. 
(c)  Release from immobilization may be obtained at the municipal court by either: 
(1)  Successfully contesting the violation and immobilization in a hearing before the municipal court within forty-eight (48) hours, or 
(2)  Paying a twenty-five dollar ($25.00) immobilization fee and all unpaid overtime parking fines to the municipal court within forty-eight (48) hours. 
(d)  If the vehicle has remained immobilized for a period of forty-eight (48) hours and release has not been obtained, the deputy or employee of Macon-Bibb County causing such immobilization shall have the vehicle towed and stored at the violator's expense. 
(e)  While a vehicle is immobilized, the parking restrictions and fees, if any, otherwise applicable shall not apply. 
(f)  It shall be unlawful for any person to remove or attempt to remove any such immobilization device before a release is obtained as herein provided or to move any such vehicle before the same is released by the municipal court. 
(g)  Release of an impounded vehicle may be obtained at the municipal court by either: 
(1)  Successfully contesting the violation and impoundment in a hearing before the municipal court within thirty (30) days of the date of impoundment, or 
(2)  Paying a twenty-five dollar ($25.00) immobilization fee and all unpaid overtime parking fines to the municipal court within thirty (30) days of the date of impoundment. In addition, the violator shall be responsible for the payment of all towing and storage fees prior to release of the vehicle from the impound lot. 
Sec. 28-94. - Private use of immobilization devices prohibited. 
(a)  Definitions. The following words, terms, and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
(1)  Vehicle immobilization device, device, or boot shall mean any mechanical device that is designed or adopted to be attached to a wheel, tire, or other part of a parked motor vehicle so as to prohibit the motor vehicle's usual manner of movement or operation. 
(2)  Operator shall mean any person, including a sole proprietor, independent contractor, partnership or similar business entity, operating vehicle immobilization devices for a vehicle immobilization service but shall not include law enforcement officers or employees authorized by the sheriff to employ such devices. 
(3)  Vehicle immobilization service shall mean a person, including a sole proprietor, independent contractor, partnership or similar business entity, offering services anywhere in Macon-Bibb County whereby vehicles are immobilized by the installation of a vehicle immobilization device. 
(b)  Prohibition. Immobilization of the vehicle of another by use of a boot or other similar device is prohibited in Macon-Bibb County. 
(c)  Violations. In addition to the penalties described in subsection (e), any person(s), operator or vehicle immobilization service found to have violated this provision may be prosecuted for trespass to chattels. 
(d)  Enforcement. The office of the sheriff of Macon-Bibb County shall be responsible for the enforcement of this section. 
(e)  Penalty. The operator cited pursuant to this section shall be liable for a monetary penalty not to exceed $500.00. 
Sec. 28-95. - Time limit for idling. 
No person shall stop or stand any Macon-Bibb County-owned motor vehicle and idle for more than fifteen (15) minutes while not in traffic. This limitation shall not apply under the following conditions: 
(1)  Emergency vehicles, construction and maintenance vehicles where the engines must run to perform the needed work; 
(2)  Motor vehicle is being used to supply heat or air conditioning necessary for passenger safety or comfort, in which case idling shall be limited to a maximum of twenty-five (25) minutes; 
(3)  If the ambient temperature is less than thirty-two (32) degrees Fahrenheit, idling shall be limited to a maximum of twenty-five (25) minutes; 
(4)  Any motor vehicle for which the primary source of energy during idling is natural gas (CNG) or electricity shall be exempt from the idling limitations set forth in this section. 
Violations of this section shall be punishable by a fine of up to five hundred ($500.00). 
Sec. 28-96—28-100. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - UNMETERED TIME CONTROLLED PARKING 

Sec. 28-101. - Unmetered parking. 
(a)  There shall be unmetered time controlled parking permitted in the downtown area of Macon-Bibb County. The sheriff is hereby authorized and directed to establish unmetered time controlled parking zones in those zones which were formerly parking meter zones, excluding the Medical Center of Central Georgia metered zone. 
(b)  The sheriff is additionally authorized and directed to establish from time to time hereafter, as traffic conditions require, additional unmetered time controlled parking zones. 
(c)  The sheriff shall cause unmetered time controlled parking spaces to be designated as provided in this division, and shall fix the time limitations for legal parking in these zones. 
Sec. 28-102. - Signs shall be posted. 
Macon-Bibb County shall cause notices to be posted in the unmetered time controlled parking zones indicating the legal free parking time as established by this division in the downtown district. 
Sec. 28-103. - Parking lines. 
The traffic engineer is instructed to mark off and identify all unmetered parking spaces. These spaces will be marked by white lines or markings painted or placed upon the street or curb for the purpose of designating the parking spaces. Each vehicle shall park within the lines or markings so established. 
Sec. 28-104. - Method of parking in time controlled, unmetered spaces. 
(a)  Except as otherwise provided in this division, every vehicle stopped or parked upon a two-way street in the area of the former City of Macon shall be so stopped or parked with the right-hand wheels parallel to and within twelve (12) inches of the right-hand curb, or as close as practicable to the right edge of the right-hand shoulder. 
(b)  Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, every vehicle stopped or parked upon a one-way roadway shall be so stopped or parked parallel to the curb or edge of the roadway, in the direction of authorized traffic movement, with its right-hand wheels within twelve (12) inches of the right-hand curb or as close as practicable to the right edge of the right-hand shoulder, or with its left-hand wheels within twelve (12) inches of the left-hand curb, or as close as practicable to the left edge of the left-hand shoulder. 
(c)  Except as otherwise provided in this division, every vehicle parked in angled unmetered parking spaces on a street in the area of the former City of Macon shall be parked with the front of the vehicle facing the curb or shoulder and parked as close as practicable to the curb or edge of the shoulder. 
(d)  Every vehicle parked in back-in only angled unmetered parking spaces on a street in the area of the former City of Macon shall be parked with the rear of the vehicle facing the curb or shoulder and parked as close as practicable to the curb or edge of the shoulder. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0003, § 3, 1-20-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-105. - Maximum parking time; illegal parking. 
(a)  Any automobile or vehicle parked in any time controlled unmetered parking space for a longer period than is designated by the provisions of this section, is illegally parked. 
(b)  No automobile or other vehicle shall occupy an unmetered parking space in any controlled parking zone on Macon-Bibb County streets continuously between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 5:30 p.m. from Monday through Saturday, in excess of the legal parking time posted pursuant to section 28-102. 
(c)  A vehicle parked in excess of the maximum time limit for any unmetered parking zone shall be parked overtime. A vehicle parked beyond the period of legal free unmetered parking shall be in violation of this section. 
(d)  No person employed by, or operating a business or profession in that area of Macon-Bibb County designated as the downtown area by this subsection, and where on street parking is controlled by this section, shall park a privately owned or company owned vehicle in any controlled parking space for the purpose of using such space as a substitute for a parking garage or other off-street parking facility, by leaving or storing such vehicle in such controlled on-street parking space while the owner or operator performs his duties at his regular place of employment. For purposes of this section the downtown area is defined as that area enclosed by the following streets: Riverside Drive from Broadway to Spring Street, inclusively; Spring Street from Riverside Drive to Mulberry Street, inclusively; Mulberry Street, from Spring Street to New Street, inclusively; New Street from Mulberry Street to Cotton Avenue, inclusively; Cotton Avenue, from New Street to Spring Street, inclusively; Spring Street, from Cotton Avenue to Orange Terrace, inclusively; Orange Terrace, from Spring Street to First Street, inclusively; First Street, from Orange Terrace to Poplar Street, inclusively; Poplar Street, from First Street to Second Street, inclusively; Second Street from Poplar Street to Plum Street, and back to Poplar, inclusively; Poplar Street from Second Street to Third Street, inclusively; Third Street from Poplar Street to Plum Street, and back to Poplar, inclusively; Poplar Street from Third Street to Broadway, inclusively; Broadway from Poplar Street to Riverside Drive, inclusively. The provisions of this subsection shall be effective between 10:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., Monday through Saturday of each week, except on those days designated as official holidays of Macon-Bibb County. Upon conviction, plea of guilty or plea of nolo contendere to a violation of the provisions of this section, the violator shall pay a fine of not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) in addition to any other punishment or penalty imposed by the municipal court. 
Sec. 28-106. - Illegal tampering with time controlled monitoring devices. 
(a)  To maintain control and accessibility of time controlled spaces to customers of downtown businesses, unmetered parking spaces shall be monitored by the sheriff and parking enforcement personnel of Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for any person to tamper with, erase, conceal or attempt to conceal, any marks placed on a vehicle or the tire thereof, by a sheriff's deputy or parking enforcement personnel for the purpose of measuring the time the parking space is occupied by that vehicle. 
(c)  Violation of subsection (b) shall be punishable by a minimum $25.00 fine. 
Sec. 28-107. - Use of downtown parking spaces by vehicles owned and operated by public utility companies franchised by Macon-Bibb County. 
A utility vehicle owned and operated by a public utility company franchised by Macon-Bibb County may park in unmetered time controlled zones in excess of the time limits set out in section 28-105 if it is: 
(1)  A clearly and permanently marked regulated service vehicle; 
(2)  Parked no further than two hundred (200) feet from the company assigned work site; and 
(3)  Operated by an employee of the utility company who is engaged in carrying out assigned company duties. 
Secs. 28-108—28-115. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 3. - PARKING ON MEDICAL CENTER GROUNDS 

Sec. 28-116. - Designation of parking areas; parking meter specifications. 
(a)  The areas designed by the Macon-Bibb County hospital authority as parking areas on the grounds of the Medical Center of Central Georgia are hereby declared to be public areas and public property. Such areas may be controlled by metered parking or unmetered time controlled parking. 
(b)  Parking meters and designated spaces on Medical Center of Central Georgia grounds shall be controlled and maintained by the security division of the Medical Center of Central Georgia. The hospital authority shall cause white lines or markings to be painted or placed upon the curb adjacent to each parking meter for the purpose of designating the parking space for which a parking meter is to be used. Each vehicle parked adjacent or next to any parking meter shall park within the lines or markings so established. 
(c)  Parking meters installed in the parking meter zones shall be placed upon the curb immediately adjacent to the individual parking places described in this division. Each parking meter shall be placed or set in such a manner as to show or display by a signal that the parking space adjacent to the meter is or is not legally in use. Each parking meter installed shall indicate by a proper legend, the legal parking time established by the city, and when operated shall indicate on and by its dial and pointer the duration of the period of legal parking, and on the expiration of the period, shall indicate illegal or overtime parking. 
Sec. 28-117. - Method of parking near meters. 
(a)  When a parking space in any parking meter zone is parallel with the adjacent curb or sidewalk, any vehicle parked in the parking space shall be parked so that the foremost part of the vehicle shall be nearest to the parking meter. When a parking space in any parking meter zone is diagonal to the curb or sidewalk, any vehicle parked in the marked space shall be parked with the foremost part of the vehicle nearest to the meter. 
(b)  When any vehicle shall be parked in any space adjacent to which a parking meter is located in accordance with the provisions of this division, the operator of the vehicle shall, upon entering the parking space, immediately deposit or cause to be deposited a coin of the United States in the parking meter of the denomination indicated by the meter for the selected period of parking. Failure to deposit the coin shall constitute a violation of this section. Coins shall be deposited in meters on Medical Center of Central Georgia grounds on all days. 
Sec. 28-118. - Illegal parking. 
(a)  Upon the deposit of a coin in the meter and placing the meter in operation, the parking space may be lawfully occupied by a vehicle during the period of parking time which has been prescribed for the space adjacent to the meter. If the vehicle shall remain parked in any parking space beyond the parking time limit fixed for the parking space, the parking meter shall, by its dial and pointer, indicate the illegal parking. In that event, the vehicle shall be considered as parked overtime and shall be in violation of this section. 
(b)  The maximum time which can be indicated at one (1) time on the parking meter adjacent to a parking space shall be the maximum time that an automobile or other vehicle may continuously occupy the parking space, and no automobile or other vehicle shall occupy a parking space on Medical Center of Central Georgia grounds continuously for a longer period of time than the maximum time which is provided by one (1) operation of the parking meter to which the parking space is adjacent, and when the maximum time has expired, the automobile or other vehicle shall vacate the space. Notwithstanding any other provisions of this section or of this division, if any vehicle shall occupy or remain parked in any parking space for a longer continuous period than can be indicated at one (1) time on the parking meter adjacent to the parking space, the vehicle so parked shall be considered parking overtime and beyond the period of legal parking time even though the meter shall indicate the vehicle is legally parked. A vehicle so parked overtime or beyond the period of legal parking time shall be in violation of this section. It is the intention of this subsection to provide that parking spaces adjacent to two-hour parking meters shall not be occupied continuously for more than two (2) hours and parking spaces adjacent to one-hour parking meters shall not be occupied continuously for longer than one (1) hour, and the same intention applies to parking meters of different available time durations now installed or which may be hereafter installed. 
Sec. 28-119. - Prohibited parking. 
(a)  The parking, standing or stopping of any vehicle in any manner so as to block ingress to and egress from either the ambulance entrance or emergency entrance to the Medical Center of Central Georgia, by vehicles engaged in transporting patients, is prohibited. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for any person to park any motor vehicle in the public parking lot of the Medical Center of Central Georgia, unless the person has parked the vehicle for the purpose of visitation or transaction of business in the Medical Center of Central Georgia. In no event shall any person park any vehicle in that public parking lot for a continuous period of time in excess of three (3) hours without express written authority from the hospital administrator. 
Secs. 28-120—28-130. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 4. - IMPOUNDMENT 

Sec. 28-131. - Authority to set up vehicle pound and to provide for towing contract. 
The mayor of Macon-Bibb County is hereby authorized and empowered to issue administrative directives providing for the maintenance of a vehicle pound on suitable public property. The mayor is further authorized and empowered to enter into a contract upon such terms and conditions as the mayor deems appropriate to provide for the towing of vehicles in conjunction with the impounding thereof. 
Sec. 28-132. - Authority to impound illegally parked vehicles. 
Whenever any vehicle shall be found parked in any place within Macon-Bibb County where parking is not permitted at that time, or whenever any vehicle shall be found parked in violation of the terms of this Code, such vehicle may be removed from the place of parking at the instance of any police officer observing the same, and impounded. 
Sec. 28-133. - Record of impounding to be made. 
It shall be the duty of the sheriff to keep a permanent record of all vehicles impounded by the office of the sheriff, together with the names and addresses of the owners of the vehicles, where available, numbers of their state license tags, description of the vehicle including motor numbers and the circumstances surrounding the impounding of the vehicles. 
Sec. 28-134. - Protest and bond. 
In case protest is made against the payment of any towing charge or storage costs, the sheriff may authorize the discharge of the vehicle if the protestant shall be charged with a violation of the traffic ordinance and shall be required to make bond for his appearance and trial before the municipal court judge. Whereupon, the sheriff shall authorize the release of the vehicle to the protestant. If such person is convicted of violating the traffic ordinance by the municipal court judge, in addition to other costs, the municipal judge shall assess as costs the storage costs and towing charges which have accumulated in connection with the impounding of the vehicle. 
Sec. 28-135. - Release of impounded vehicles. 
Any person claiming the impounded vehicle shall produce evidence of his identity and ownership or right of possession to the sheriff. Upon payment of storage costs and towing charges, and the execution of a release and receipt of the city for the vehicle, the sheriff shall issue an order authorizing a release of the vehicle to the claimant. 
Sec. 28-136. - Disposition of unclaimed vehicles. 
(a)  If any impounded car is not claimed within thirty (30) days from the date it is impounded, Macon-Bibb County shall dispose of the property as provided for abandoned automobiles. 
(b)  Notwithstanding other provisions of this Code, whenever the vehicles to be sold cannot be moved under their own power, or whenever the governing authority shall find as a fact that the sale of the vehicles can be more expeditiously had by conducting the sale where the vehicles are stored, the sale may be had at the place of storage provided that the advertisement of the sale shall give notice that the vehicles are to be sold at the place of storage. 
Sec. 28-137. - Impounding does not preclude other prosecution. 
The impounding of a vehicle shall not prevent or preclude other prosecution for violation of the provisions of this Code. 
Sec. 28-138. - Reserved. 
Division 5. - Downtown Parking Accessibility[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 , set out provisions for use herein as div. 5, §§ 28-140—28-153. Inasmuch as similar section numbers existed at the time of codification, those provisions have been renumbered as §§ 28-139—28-139.13. 

Sec. 28-139. - Definitions. 
The following words and terms are defined for the purpose of this division only: 
Downtown Area , for the purposes of this division, is defined as being all that area along and inclusive of the following boundaries: From the intersection of Spring Street and Riverside Drive, running along Riverside Drive to Martin Luther King, Jr. Blvd., along Martin Luther King, Jr. Blvd. to Fifth Street, branching along Fifth Street to Oak Street, running along Oak Street as it becomes Hemlock Street to the intersection of Spring Street and along Spring Street back to Riverside Drive. 
Parking Enforcement Officer as employed in its singular or plural form in this division shall refer to any person(s) as designated individually or by job description classification by the Macon-Bibb Count Commission, employees of the Bibb County Sheriffs department, or employees employed by an agency which has a contract with the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority for parking enforcement purposes, as having authority to enforce sections of this division pertaining to regulations and enforcement of provisions pertaining to the parking of vehicles in the downtown area and residential parking areas adjacent to the downtown area as designated from time to time by resolution of the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority, provided such person has satisfied the standards of the parking management company as to training in the enforcement duties permitted to be undertaken by that person relating to this section. Any such contract with a company hired by Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority to enforce the provisions of this division shall require such owner to be responsible for the duties and supervision of any such Parking Enforcement Officer, shall indemnify and hold harmless both Macon-Bibb County and the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority from any acts of any such person, and shall require that the owner maintain contractual obligation liability insurance for its undertakings pursuant to that contract. The Mayor shall be authorized to terminate the authority of any person designated as a Parking Enforcement Officer by the company pursuant to this division immediately and without any right to any hearing or other appeal at any time upon written notice delivered to such company. 
Metered Parking , for the purposes of this division, is defined as a parking zone designated by the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority in which a vehicle may be properly parked, which shall be indicated by clearly painted lines or otherwise, and which is regulated by parking time limits designed to improve downtown parking accessibility. 
Metered Parking Device , for the purposes of this division, is defined as any technology device used for the regulation of parking by authority of this division and shall include, but not be limited to, single space meters, pay stations, pay and display, and pay by plate. 
Operator , for purposes of this division, is defined as every individual who shall operate a vehicle as the owner thereof, or as the agent, employee, or permittee of the owner. 
Vehicle, for purposes of this division, is defined as any device upon by which any person or property is or may be transported upon a highway, road, or street, except a device which is operated upon rails or tracks. 
Zones, for purposes of this division, shall include those parking spaces on streets and in parking lots designated for Metered Parking by the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.1. - Purpose; downtown parking accessibility plan. 
(a)  The purpose of this division is to improve parking accessibility so as to aid, assist, and improve retail and commercial opportunities in the Downtown Area; to reduce hazardous traffic conditions resulting from the use of streets within the Downtown Area; to protect such areas from polluted air, excessive noise, litter and refuse caused by the circulation of such vehicles; to protect the customers, employees, and residents of such areas from unreasonable burdens in gaining access to businesses and their residences; to preserve the character of the downtown and residential areas; to promote efficiency in the maintenance of streets in such Downtown Area in a clean and safe condition; to preserve the value of the property in such areas; and to preserve the safety of children, other pedestrians and traffic, as well as the peace, good order, comfort, convenience and welfare of the inhabitants of Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  The Commission does hereby authorize, assign, and designate the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority with the responsibility for developing, implementing, and managing a Downtown Parking Accessibility Plan designed to aid, assist, and improve retail and commercial opportunities and development in the Downtown Area to include, but not be limited to, implementation of a comprehensive Metered Parking management and enforcement services accessibility program for on-street, off-street, and residential parking in designated Zones. 
(c)  The Commission does hereby authorize the Authority to put out an RFP and select a vendor to provide the services required for implementation of said Plan and to manage and maintain any equipment, meters, signage, devices, computer programs, apps, or other devices required for implementation of the Downtown Parking Accessibility Plan. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.2. - Metered parking zones. 
(a)  The Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority shall develop and implement regulations necessary to establish and implement the Downtown Parking Accessibility Plan within the Downtown Area, which regulations must conform to the provisions of this division. 
(b)  Whenever by this division or any other ordinance of Macon-Bibb County any parking time limit is imposed in designated Zones, it shall be the duty of the Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority and/or the parking management firm selected by said Authority to erect appropriate signs giving notice thereof, and such regulations shall not be effective unless such signs are erected and in place at the time of any alleged offense. 
(c)  The Macon-Bibb County Urban Development Authority shall designate which Zones in the Downtown Area shall be designated for use of Metered Parking and shall be responsible for installing or providing the necessary Metered Parking Devices. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.3. - Deposit of charges. 
When any vehicle is located in a Metered Parking Zone, the operator of the vehicle shall, upon entering the parking space, immediately deposit or cause to be deposited into a Metered Parking Device the charges, as provided by this division, in legal United States funds and other acceptable forms of payment as provided for said parking space. Upon the deposit of the charges in the Metered Parking Device, the parking space for which the charges were remitted may be lawfully occupied by the vehicle during the period of parking time which has been prescribed. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.4. - Use of parking meter revenue. 
Metered Parking fees are hereby levied and assessed to provide for the proper regulation and control of traffic and the parking of vehicles upon the public streets and to defray the costs of the total on-street and off-street parking management program, including the cost of acquiring, installing, operating, maintaining, supervising, regulating, and controlling Metered Parking devices. Any revenue derived from fees, fines, parking rentals, or other accessibility plan components shall be used by the Macon-Bibb County Development Authority to pay for the cost of implementation of the plan as described above and to provide streetscape improvements designed to improve parking accessibility. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.5. - Defacing, tampering with, etc. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to deface, injure, tamper with, open or willfully break, destroy or impair the usefulness of any Metered Parking Device installed under the provisions of this division. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.6. - Parking overtime. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to cause, allow, permit or suffer any vehicle registered in the name of or operated by such person to be parked overtime or beyond the period of legal parking time established for any Metered Parking Zone as described in this division. 
(b)  The exceeding of each segment of time or fraction thereof beyond the initial lawful unit of time shall constitute a separate violation of this division. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.7. - Loading zones. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park to park any vehicle in a designated loading zone except for the purpose of loading or unloading such vehicle, which vehicle must be properly identified showing that it is a delivery or pick-up vehicle. A delivery or pick-up vehicle may park in a designated loading zone only during such time as materials are being loaded and/or unloaded from the vehicle, and in no case may such vehicle remain parked in a designated loading zone for longer than 30 minutes, unless a different time is indicated by a sign or permitted under the Downtown Parking Accessibility Plan. A vehicle must be removed from the loading zone immediately upon completion of loading and/or unloading materials from such vehicle or the expiration of time limit for that loading zone, whichever occurs first. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.8. - Parking in no parking zone. 
It shall be unlawful for any vehicle, or motorcycle or any other motorized vehicle, to be parked on the sidewalk or other public right-of-way in any space that is not a designated marked parking space nor shall any such vehicle be parked in front of any driveway so as to block access to the public portion thereof or within ten feet of such driveway. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.9. - Parking outside the lines of designated parking space. 
It shall be unlawful for any vehicle, or motorcycle or any other motorized vehicle, to be parked outside the lines of a designated parking space. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.10. - Parking in the wrong direction for a designated parking space. 
It shall be unlawful for any vehicle, or motorcycle or any other motorized vehicle, to be parked in the wrong direction for a designated parking space. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.11. - Notice to be attached to vehicle. 
A Parking Enforcement Officer finding a vehicle parked in violation of this division shall attach to such vehicle a notice to the owner or operator thereof that such vehicle has been parked in violation of a provision of this division and instructing such owner or operator of the manner in which such citation is to be paid or otherwise resolved. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.12. - Legal parking violations. 
(a)  The owner of a motor vehicle shall be subject to the following civil fines for the violations enumerated herein. Except as otherwise specified, all other violations under this chapter shall be within the limits permitted under section 1-6. Any violations enumerated herein that are not otherwise punishable by section 1-6 shall be deemed non-criminal, shall be determined by a showing of preponderance of the evidence, and shall not be deemed to be a conviction. Such civil violations are inapplicable to a person's motor vehicle driving record for insurance purposes in the provision of motor vehicle insurance coverage. 
(b)  The civil fine for the following legal parking zone violations shall be as follows: 
(1)  Parking overtime ..... $10.00 
(2)  Loading zones ..... $50.00 
(3)  No parking zone ..... $50.00 
(4)  Parking outside the lines of a designated parking space ..... $25.00 
(5)  Parking in the wrong direction for a designated parking space ..... $25.00 
(c)  Court summons; bond for failure to appear. If the value of accumulated unpaid parking tickets is more than $50.00, a vehicle owner shall be issued a summons to appear in the municipal court of Macon-Bibb County. If the owner fails to appear at the appointed time and date as specified in the summons, he or she shall be subject to arrest and shall post a $50.00 bond plus an amount equal to all fines and penalties accrued to date. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
Sec. 28-139.13. - Construction permit parking fees in downtown area; penalty for violation. 
(a)  There shall be a construction permit parking for the use of parking spaces in the Downtown Area by contractors in the performance of their work as follows: 
Per parking space, per day\$6.00 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the operator of any motor vehicle to park their motor vehicle in any space which has been designated for construction parking. 
( Ord. of 11-15-2016(1), § 1 ) 
ARTICLE IV. - INSTALLATION OF SPEED TABLES 

Sec. 28-140. - Speed table program. 
Macon-Bibb County has adopted a speed table program to aid citizens in determining if their residential street has a speeding problem and to determine whether the installation of speed tables as traffic calming devices is an appropriate option. The Macon-Bibb County traffic engineering division shall be responsible for implementing the county's speed table program. The installation and removal of speed tables shall be done in compliance with the Macon-Bibb County speed table program manual adopted by the commission. See Bibb County Speed Table Program Manual, attached to Ord. No. VV-09-9 as exhibit "1." 
Editor's note— The manual referred to in this section is not set out at length herein, but is on file in the offices of the Macon-Bibb County clerk of commission. 
ARTICLE V. - MOTORIZED CARTS 

Sec. 28-141. - Findings and definitions. 
(a)  The Board of Commissioners finds that certain public streets located within Macon-Bibb County are designed and constructed so as to safely permit the use of regular vehicular traffic and also the driving thereon of motorized carts. The Board of Commissioners further finds that the use of motorized carts is a convenient and safe form of short distance travel that conserves resources and enhances the quality of life of the citizens of Macon-Bibb County. However, to ensure the public safety and welfare, the operation of motorized carts must not only comply with normal regulations regarding vehicles but should comply with special safety regulations intended to protect the operator and passengers in a motorized cart. This Article establishes the basic, minimum standards of care to be used by the operators of motorized carts on public roads and streets. Likewise, public safety requires that motorized carts, when used as a means of transportation, must also meet certain minimum safety standards that can only be assured through a system of regulation and inspection. 
(b)  The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this chapter, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
Authorized Street means all such streets which have been authorized for motorized cart travel by the Board of Commissioners and are on file with the Sheriff's Office. The list of authorized streets is subject to amendment from time to time by the Board of Commissioners, and the public shall be allowed to submit written requests that the Commissioners review streets for approval of such designations. Each such street which has been designated as an authorized street must receive approval by the Board of Commissioners prior to such designation. A full list of authorized streets shall be maintained by the Sheriff's Office. 
County means Macon-Bibb County, Georgia. 
Motorized Cart means all electric and gasoline-powered pleasure carts, which are commonly called golf carts, and which are not capable of exceeding twenty (20) miles per hour. Within this article, the terms "motorized cart," "golf cart" and "cart" shall have the same meanings; these are the only carts authorized for use under this Article. Other All-Terrain Vehicles, including Four-Wheelers, shall not be allowed under this Article. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-142 - Registration of motorized carts. 
(a)  It shall be the duty of every owner of a motorized cart that is operated over authorized streets to register the motorized cart with the County prior to operating said motorized cart on said authorized streets. The application for registration shall be filed with the Sheriff; or to his/her designee, on forms provided by the Sheriff's Office. The application may, among other things, require the following information: owner's name; street address, mailing address, and telephone number; make, model, and identification, and serial number of the motorized cart; and such other information as may be reasonably required, as well as a general release statement and/or disclaimer of any liability by the County for accidents involving the registered motorized cart. Two (2) decals shall be issued upon registration; and a record of each motorized cart number, along with the name and address of the owner, shall be maintained by the Sheriff's Office. 
(b)  The decals provided upon proper registration must be affixed to the sides or windshield of the motorized cart in such a manner as to be fully visible at all times. The failure to have a current registration decal on a motorized cart shall be a violation of this section and subject the owner/operator of such cart to penalties. The decal issued by the Sheriff's Office shall be non-transferrable from the motorized cart for which it is obtained. 
(c)  Only those persons eighteen (18) years of age and older may register a motorized cart. Motorized cart registration may be in one person's name only, and the registration form must be signed by that person. 
(d)  The fee to register a motorized cart shall be set at fifteen dollars ($15.00) per motorized cart. The registration is good for a period of one (1) year from the issuance date and shall be renewed annually so long as the motorized cart is in use on authorized streets. 
(e)  Prior to issuing the initial registration permit or any renewal thereof, the golf cart shall be physically inspected by the Sheriff's Office to determine that: 
(1)  The golf cart is equipped with a rear vision mirror and at least two (2) red rear reflectors which are at least three (3) inches in height and width; and 
(2)  The golf cart is equipped with a reflective "slow moving" sign, caution sign, and/or flag on the rear of the cart; and 
(3)  The brakes provided by the manufacturer of the golf cart are in proper working order; and 
(4)  The golf cart has all of the standard safety features provided by the manufacturer and has not been modified to exceed a speed of twenty (20) miles per hour nor otherwise modified in any way that creates a hazard; and 
(5)  The golf cart is equipped with all mechanical systems and safety equipment required by this Chapter. 
(f)  Any owner or operator registering a motorized cart with the County agrees to abide by all of the requirements of State law and this Code. By registering a motorized cart with the County, the owner or operator verifies that the motorized cart qualifies to be classified as such under State law. 
(g)  Upon occurrence of a sale of the motorized cart to another person who shall operate the cart over the authorized streets of the County, the registration must be transferred to the new owner within ten (10) business days of the change in ownership at a cost of ten dollars ($10.00). The motorized cart shall be considered an unregistered cart after the ten (10) business-day period. Dealers acquiring a registered cart exclusively for resale (non-rental) shall not be required to pay the transfer charge, but shall notify the County of the transfer within ten (10) business days of receiving the cart, and of the ultimate disposition of the cart within ten (10) business days of sale. 
(h)  The initial registration of a golf cart may be denied or subsequently revoked by the Sheriff's Office if it is determined that: 
(1)  The application contains any material misrepresentation; or 
(2)  The motorized cart is not in compliance with the requirements of this Article; or 
(3)  The motorized cart has been altered or customized and no longer meets the definition of a motorized cart as defined by this Article; or 
(4)  Equipment supplied by the manufacturer, especially safety equipment, has been removed from the golf cart or the vehicle identification or serial number has been removed; or 
(5)  Other good cause shown, including repeated violations of this Article. 
(i)  All-terrain vehicles, 4-wheel utility vehicles and other similar utility vehicles which are not manufactured for operation on a golf course, and golf carts that have been modified so that they no longer meet the definition of a motorized cart as defined by this Article may not be registered as a motorized cart nor shall such vehicles be operated on the public roads, streets and highways within the County unless such vehicles are otherwise registered with and allowed under the motor vehicle laws of the State of Georgia. 
(j)  The Board of Commissioners may, at its discretion, waive registration requirements for special events of limited duration during which persons may bring motorized carts as participants. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-143. - Operation of gasoline-powered motorized carts. 
(a)  Every motorized cart which is powered by gasoline shall at all times be equipped with an exhaust system in good working order and in constant operation, meeting the following specifications: 
(1)  The exhaust system shall include the piping leading from the flange of the exhaust manifold to, and including, the muffler(s) and exhaust pipe(s); and 
(2)  The exhaust system and its elements shall be securely fastened; and 
(3)  The engine of every motorized cart shall be so equipped, adjusted and tuned, as to prevent the escape of excessive smoke or fumes. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the owner of any motorized cart which is powered by gasoline to operate, or permit the operation, of such motorized cart on which any device controlling or abating atmospheric emissions, which is placed on a motorized cart by the manufacturer, has been altered, rendered unserviceable or removed. 
(c)  Motorized carts which are powered by electric means are exempted from this Section. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-144. - Operating regulations. 
(a)  Any person who possesses a valid motor vehicle driver's license issued by any State or Territory of the United States of America, and is at least sixteen (16) years of age, may operate a motorized cart on the authorized streets. Any passengers on a motorized cart on an authorized street must be at least eight (8) years of age. 
(b)  Any person who possesses a valid motor vehicle learner's permit issued by any State or Territory of the United States of America, and is at least fifteen (15) years of age, may operate a motorized cart on the authorized streets, so long as such person is accompanied in the front seat by a person who possesses a valid motor vehicle driver's license issued by any State or Territory of the United States of America and who is at least eighteen (18) years of age. 
(c)  No person less than fifteen (15) years of age shall be permitted to operate a motorized cart on the authorized streets under any circumstances. 
(d)  All operators of motorized carts shall abide by all traffic regulations applicable to vehicular traffic when using the authorized streets. Furthermore, all laws regarding the use of motor vehicles in the State of Georgia and all ordinances regarding the use of motor vehicles in the County, not inconsistent therewith, shall be observed by all motorized carts, except that no motorized carts may be operated at a speed in excess of twenty (20) miles per hour. 
(e)  Motorized carts shall not be operated on sidewalks at any time. 
(f)  Motorized carts may be operated over authorized streets only during daylight hours, unless such motorized carts are equipped with functional headlights and taillights and any other such equipment regulations which may be promulgated by the Commissioner of Public Safety of the State of Georgia. 
(g)  No person shall operate a motorized cart on a public road unless that road has been authorized for motorized cart use by this Article and appropriate signs giving notice are posted along said public road. 
(h)  Motorized carts may not be operated on any streets or sections of streets, except for areas designated as crossing at a signalized intersection or at a perpendicular crossing at a through intersection, where: 
(1)  Any street where the posted speed limit is more than thirty-five (35) miles per hour; or any street designated as a State Route. 
(2)  Any Interstate highway, including Interstate 16 and Interstate 75. 
(i)  Motorized cart owners shall maintain their motorized carts in a manner which ensures that an unobstructed view from the driver's seat to the rear is maintained at all times the motorized cart is in operation on public roads.
