(j)  The maximum occupancy of a motorized cart traveling on any authorized street or public property shall be one (1) person per designated seat. The operator and passenger of a motorized cart shall remain seated at all times in which the motorized cart is in motion. 
(k)  Motorized carts may not be used for the commercial purpose of transporting passengers, and may not be used as a taxi, bus, or any other commercial transportation service. 
(l)  Motorized cart operators shall yield the right-of-way to overtaking motor vehicles. 
(m)  Motorized carts may be parked in the same manner and at the same places designated for the parking of motor vehicles. The stopping, standing, or parking of motorized carts in areas where parking is not allowed or in any place that impedes the flow of traffic, pedestrian walkways, or a passageway is prohibited and subject to penalty. 
(n)  It shall be unlawful for the owner of any motorized cart to operate, or permit the operation of, such cart over the authorized streets in violation of this article. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-145. - Hazardous activities and special rules. 
No individual or group shall engage in hazardous activities on the authorized streets. Such hazardous activities include, but are not limited to, the following: 
(1)  Racing of any kind, except for special events approved by the County; and 
(2)  Blocking of public access, except for special events approved by the County; and 
(3)  Motorized carts shall not loiter or park on bridges or in underpasses; and 
(4)  All laws and ordinances relative to alcohol and the use thereof, including open container laws, apply to motorized carts; and 
(5)  Motorized carts may not be used to for the purpose of towing another cart, trailer, vehicle of any kind, or any person on skates, bicycles, or any other object. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-146. - Exemptions. 
(a)  The operation of motorized carts under the following circumstances shall not be subject to the provisions of this Article: 
(1)  The operation of motorized carts at golf courses, private clubs, or on private property, with the consent of the land owner; and 
(2)  The operation of golf carts on private streets within gated or limited access communities; and 
(3)  The operation of golf carts in connection with a parade, festival, or other special event authorized by the County, provided that the consent of the event sponsor is obtained and provided that such use only occurs during the special event; and 
(4)  The use of golf carts by the Sheriff's Department on official police business or by other Macon-Bibb County personnel for official business on County controlled property, including cemeteries, parks, green space, and other property as needed. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-147. - Liability. 
The owner and/or operator of a motorized cart is liable for his or her own actions and assumes all responsibility for any such use. Any person who operates or owns a motorized cart is responsible for procuring liability insurance and verifying coverage in terms enough to cover risk involved in using such motorized cart on authorized streets. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Sec. 28-148. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person who violates the terms of this Article shall be cited to appear before the Municipal Court or other Court of appropriate jurisdiction, and upon conviction, be punished in accordance with Section 1-6 of the Macon-Bibb County Code of Ordinances. 
(b)  In addition to enforcing sanctions against the operator of the motorized cart, any violation of this Article shall also be charged against the registered owner of the motorized cart, and all fines and penalties shall be levied against the registered owner of the motorized cart as follows: 
(1)  For the first offense, a fine of not less than one hundred dollars ($150.00). 
(2)  For the second offense, a fine of not less than three hundred dollars ($300.00). 
(3)  For a third offense committed within one (1) year of conviction for a second offense for a motorized cart, a fine of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), and the registered owner's motorized cart registration shall be revoked. The registered owner or family member cannot thereafter register a motorized cart for use in the city for a period of two (2) years following the third conviction. 
( Ord. No. O-15-0010, § 1, 2-3-2015 ) 
Chapter 29 - UTILITIES AND FRANCHISES 
ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 29-1. - Use of rights-of-way; petition; advertisement. 
(a)  No person shall use or occupy the streets to operate a utility, within Macon-Bibb County, including but not limited to the operation of railroads, street railways, urban transportation companies, electric or light power companies, gas companies, steam-heat companies, telecommunications or cable companies, or water companies without first having obtained a franchise agreement from Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  Any person who seeks the right to exercise a franchise in Macon-Bibb County which contemplates or makes necessary the erection and construction of any building, poles, wires, conduits, tracks or other similar equipment, in, upon or over any street located in Macon-Bibb County, shall file a written petition therefor. The petition shall contain an accurate description of the rights sought to be secured, and shall be accompanied by a plat showing the exact location or proposed location of the building, poles, tracks and the like, together with all streets upon or over which it is sought to exercise the franchise. 
(c)  The petition shall be filed with the clerk of commission accompanied by a deposit sufficient to cover the cost of advertising the petition as provided in this chapter, and no petition shall be received, filed, or presented to the commission until the full amount of the cost of the advertising shall have been first paid to the clerk of commission, who shall keep a record thereof. The petition shall be advertised in the official newspaper of Macon-Bibb County at least once a week for four weeks before it shall be considered by the city council commission or any committee thereof. 
(d)  Existing franchises from the City of Macon and/or Bibb County shall continue in force and effect in Macon-Bibb County until such time as said franchises expire, are renewed, or new franchises are issued by the commission. 
(e)  (1)  It shall be unlawful for any person, except a franchisee, to place any telephone, telegraph or other wires, cables, conduits, pipes, or other equipment used for telecommunications, cable or other communications purposes upon, under or above the rights-of-way of any street without first having obtained an access agreement with Macon-Bibb County as allowed by state law. Such agreement shall specify the name of the street involved, the purpose for which the wire, pipe, cable or conduit is run, the type and length of wire, cable, pipe, or conduit to be run, the extent of the construction to be performed, and the time allowed for performance of the work. The installation of such telephone or telegraph wires, cables or conduits shall be done by a licensed contractor and such work shall be done in a workmanlike manner in accordance with any specifications provided in regulations adopted by the Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
(2)  Such access agreement shall be granted only for a specified portion of particular streets and shall provide for compensation to Macon-Bibb County in an amount not to exceed the maximum amounts specified or allowed by state or federal law. 
Sec. 29-2. - Installation of aboveground and belowground utilities. 
(a)  The words "public utility," for the purposes of this section, shall include but shall not be limited to water lines, gas lines, sewer lines, pipelines, telephone lines, power lines, telecommunication cables, conduits and every other structure or device which by physical or electronic means conveys energy or substance, whether overhead or underground, along with supporting pedestals, poles and equipment. 
(b)  No person shall install or relocate any utility without compliance with this section. 
(c)  Before any public utility may be installed or relocated, application for a permit shall be made to the engineer of Macon-Bibb County. The application for the permit shall contain the name and address of the applicant, a description of the location and nature of the public utility and such other information as the engineer may reasonably require. The engineer shall issue a permit for such installation or relocation which conforms to this chapter. 
(d)  The Macon-Bibb County engineer shall not approve any permit for the installation or relocation of an underground utility where the topmost portion of the conduit, cable, wire, pipe or other feature is less than 30 inches below the surface of the ground at the time of completion of the installation, nor shall the engineer permit installation or relocation of an overhead utility where any aboveground fixture, pole, pedestal, or feature is not behind the ditch in a rural section, or behind the curb in an urban section, upon completion. 
(e)  The engineer may make other reasonable requirements governing the installation or relocation as shall be necessary to provide reasonable protection to the utility and to persons and property, both public and private. No public utility, once installed, shall be relocated without application for and receipt of a permit, and then only so long as its relocation meets the location requirements outlined in subsection (d). 
(f)  Whenever any person shall desire to change the conditions which were present at the time a public utility was appropriately installed (by grading, installing a driveway or private street, piping a ditch, etc.) in such fashion as to reduce the depth of an underground utility, or to otherwise necessitate relocation of any public utility, such person shall make prior arrangements for such relocation so as to comply with the location parameters required by subsection (d). The cost of such relocation shall be borne by the person desiring to change the conditions which would necessitate a relocation, unless otherwise agreed between the person and the utility; provided, however, that whenever it shall become requisite to relocate a utility by reason of necessity to grade, widen or otherwise improve a public roadway, drainage system, or sidewalk then in existence, the cost of such relocation of the utility shall be the expense of the owner of the utility unless otherwise provided in the franchise agreement. 
(g)  Any person who is installing an overhead wire or cable requiring an access agreement across a street or highway shall at all times maintain a minimum 18-foot clearance above the surface of such street or highway. 
(h)  Any person who is installing an underground wire, cable, pipe, or conduit requiring an access agreement shall also comply with the provisions of chapter 18 which deals with excavations into a public street. 
(i)  The Macon-Bibb County engineer shall be authorized to require a holder of an access agreement to relocate their wire, cable or conduit if such relocation is a public necessity. The engineer may also require an overhead wire or cable to be relocated if the street involved should convert from an overhead telephone system to an underground telephone system. 
Sec. 29-3. - Placement of poles; supervision by engineer; removal. 
(a)  Telegraph, telephone, and electric poles shall only be erected in a manner that best promotes pedestrian mobility and the work shall be done under the supervision of and subject to the approval of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. On failure of any company or person to locate these poles as required by this section, the mayor shall have power to remove such poles, and the expense of the removal shall be collected in the same manner as delinquent taxes are collected. It shall be the duty of every public utility company to apply to the engineer for directions as to the streets and alleys through which poles are to be placed and the engineer shall also regulate the distance between the poles. 
(b)  The mayor is hereby authorized and empowered to order the removal of or to remove all unsightly or dangerous poles in Macon-Bibb County, belonging to the several public utility companies. The cost of the removal to be collected as provided in subsection (a). Such removal shall be accomplished within 90 days of notification. 
Sec. 29-4. - Name of company stamped on poles. 
All public utility companies doing business in Macon-Bibb County are hereby required to place on each pole six feet above the base thereof a metal tag with the name of the company to which the pole belongs stamped thereon. 
Sec. 29-5. - Poles installed at expense of company. 
For the purpose of reaching the premises of users of electric service furnished by any company or person operating within Macon-Bibb County under a franchise therefrom, the necessary poles for the service shall be placed at the expense of the company or the person to the property line of the consumer. 
Sec. 29-6. - Removal of poles. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to remove from the streets or sidewalks of Macon-Bibb County any telegraph, telephone, or other poles so as to leave any part of the pole exposed above the surface of the street or sidewalk. 
Sec. 29-7. - Manner of removal. 
With the exception hereinafter referred to and described, all poles shall be removed in the following manner: 
(1)  Where that portion of the sidewalk or street from which the pole is to be removed has not been paved, the pole shall be taken from the ground and the hole from which it is so taken shall be filled and the dirt placed therein securely packed so as to avoid settling. 
(2)  When the portion of sidewalk or street from which the pole is to be taken is paved, the pole shall be removed and repaired to the satisfaction of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. The pole shall be removed in its entirety and the resulting hole in the pavement shall be repaired with the same kind of material as that surrounding it. 
(3)  No holes shall be left unfilled unless barricades are placed to ensure the safety of the public. Final repairs shall be made within 30 days of the pole removal. 
Sec. 29-8. - Wires to be underground in certain area. 
Public utility companies shall maintain underground power on those streets in the urban core that currently have underground power. Underground utilities shall not be converted to overhead power without approval of the Macon-Bibb County commission. 
Sec. 29-9. - Requirements for placement of underground wires. 
All persons to whom permission may be granted for renewing or laying underground conduits, tubes, or pipes for electrical conductors, cables, or wires, shall conform to the following requirements: 
(1)  No streets shall be broken or occupied by any person for the purpose of laying down conduits, tubes, or pipes for electrical conductors, cables, or wires, except by written permission of the engineer. 
(2)  During the construction or laying down of the underground conduits, tubes, or pipes, conductors, cables, or wires, no streets shall be opened or the pavement broken for a greater distance than 500 feet at any one opening, and no section of the 500 feet shall be kept open for a longer period than ten days, and the opening shall not be of greater width than four feet except where permitted by the Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
(3)  As the work progresses the pavement shall be properly relaid and the street put in good condition. 
Sec. 29-10. - Application to lay underground wires; permit required; access by Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
Prior to making any opening in any street, for the laying of conduits, tubes, or pipes for electrical conductors, cables, or wires, the person desiring to lay the same shall make application to the Macon-Bibb County engineer, in writing, and shall file plans and specifications showing the location, the route, and the length of the proposed conduits, pipes, and tubes. The engineer shall have authority to issue the necessary permit for the opening of the street, as set forth in the application and plans. The opening of the street, without a permit having been first obtained, shall forfeit the right of any person to use or occupy the street. The work of laying any underground conduits, tubes, pipes, electrical conductors, cables, and wires shall be under the direction and approval of the Macon-Bibb County engineer, who shall at all times have free and unobstructed access to the conduits, tubes, pipes, electrical conductors, or cables, for the purpose of inspecting the same, or making connections therewith for wires or conductors in use or to be used by Macon-Bibb County. 
Sec. 29-11. - Cutting of wires unlawful. 
It shall be unlawful for any person, except employees of a telephone, telegraph, or electric light or power company, acting under orders, to cut a wire or alter its position without the knowledge or consent of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
Sec. 29-12. - One free duct for governmental purposes. 
Any person placing conduits under the foregoing provisions shall furnish to Macon-Bibb County on demand one duct in the same location for governmental purposes, without charge, provided no electric light or power wire shall be used in a telephone or telegraph conduit. 
Sec. 29-13. - Annual report on underground wires. 
All persons having telegraph, telephone, or electric wires, electrical conductors, or cables placed underground shall, in writing on or before January first of each year, report under oath to the mayor and to the Macon-Bibb County commission the actual number of wires, the location, and the miles of wire and electrical conductors underground, owned or leased or controlled by that person in Macon-Bibb County. 
Sec. 29-14. - Forfeiture. 
Should any person, to whom the right of franchise has heretofore been or shall hereafter be granted to lay underground wires, electrical conductors, cables, or tubes, dispose of such right of franchise, or lease to, consolidate, or merge with any other company, corporation, firm, or person, without first obtaining permission of the mayor and commission to so dispose of or lease, consolidate, or merge, the person shall forfeit all franchise rights and privileges granted. 
Sec. 29-15. - Liability for damage; bond. 
(a)  All persons occupying any street with underground conduits, tubes, pipes, cables, electrical conductors, or wires, shall be liable for all damages to gas and water main service and storm or sanitary sewer connections, and also liable for any damage caused by the opening of trenches, or the defective condition of streets, resulting from such laying of conduits, tubes, pipes, electrical conductors, cables, or wires, for which damage Macon-Bibb County might otherwise be held liable. 
(b)  A sufficient indemnity bond, certificate of liability insurance, or other approved security shall be given, subject to the approval of the mayor, at the time of granting permission for the underground activities, in the minimum sum of $10,000.00 to cover such damage, and save Macon-Bibb County harmless. 
(c)  The access agreement issued under section 29-1(e) shall also specify that the holder of an access agreement shall at all times be responsible to the public and hold the city harmless for any property damage or personal injury caused or occasioned by the installation, maintenance or occupancy of any wire, cable or conduit under, upon or above a street or highway right-of-way as permitted in this article. 
Secs. 29-16—29-35. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE II. - ELECTRIC SERVICE 

Sec. 29-36. - Authority of utility company to install and maintain distribution system. 
Authority, right, permission, and consent are hereby granted to the Georgia Power Company, its successors, lessees, and assigns, for a period of 99 years, to occupy and use the streets, alleys, and public places of the city within its present and future limits as from time to time the Georgia Power Company, its successors, lessees, and assigns, may deem proper or necessary for the erection and maintenance of underground circuits or ducts, poles, towers, lines, wires, cables, insulators, transformers, and all appliances or connections for the business and purpose of transmitting, conveying, conducting, using, supplying, and distributing electricity for light, heat, power, and other purposes for which electric current may be useful or practicable for public or private use, and to re-enter upon the streets, alleys, and public places from time to time as may be necessary for the extension, operation, repair, and renewal of the same or any portion thereof, and to cut and trim trees and shrubbery when and where necessary, in the judgment of the company, to insure safe and efficient service. 
Sec. 29-37. - Consideration, terms and conditions. 
(a)  The rights, permission, and consents herein contained are made for the following consideration and upon the following terms and conditions: 
(1)  The Georgia Power Company, its successors and assigns, shall pay into the treasury of the city on or before the first day of March each year, beginning with the year 1966, a sum of money equal to four percent of the gross sales of electric energy to customers served under residential and commercial rate schedules (as prescribed by the state public service commission), within the corporate limits of the city for the preceding calendar year so long as the city itself shall not engage in any such competing utility business, and on condition that in the event the shall grant to any other corporation the right to use and occupy its streets for like purposes, that use and occupancy shall be upon the same terms and conditions as those herein contained, including the payment of a license, privilege, or occupation tax in an amount at least equal to that herein specified. On and after January 1, 2014, the Georgia Power Company shall pay to Macon-Bibb County as the successor government to the City of Macon the sum of four percent of the gross sales of electric energy to customers served under the residential, commercial, and industrial rate schedules (as prescribed by the state public service commission), within Macon-Bibb County for the preceding calendar year so long as Macon-Bibb County shall not engage in any competing utility business, and on the condition that in the event Macon-Bibb County shall grant to any other corporation the right to use and occupy its streets for like purposes, that use and occupancy shall be upon the same terms and conditions as those herein contained. 
(2)  The payment of the percentage of gross sales provided for shall be in lieu of all other occupation, license, excise, and special franchise taxes, and in full of all money demands and charges, except ad valorem taxes on property and business taxes on the sale of appliances; and whatever amount, if any, shall at any time be required or exacted for the benefit of Macon-Bibb County on any of the accounts or on any account, other than ad valorem taxes on property and business taxes on the sale of appliances, shall operate to reduce to that extent the amount due from the percentage above provided for. 
(3)  Should the city Macon-Bibb County ever at any time construct, purchase, lease, acquire, own, hold, use, or operate an electric lighting or power plant and distribution system, with the single exception of a power plant for water pumping and pumping station lighting purposes and none other at the present location of the Macon-Bibb County water pumping station then and in that event the payment of the percentage of gross sales herein provided to be paid by the Georgia Power Company, its successors and assigns, shall abate, cease, and be no longer due, and shall forever thereafter be uncollectible. 
(4)  The work of erecting poles and all other work upon the streets and public places of Macon-Bibb County shall be done under the supervision of the mayor and commission as may be provided by this Code, and all sidewalks or street pavements or street surface which may be displaced by reason of such work shall be properly replaced and relaid by the Georgia Power Company, its successors, lessees, and assigns, to the satisfaction of Macon-Bibb County. 
(5)  The Georgia Power Company, its successors and assigns, shall fully protect, indemnify, and save harmless Macon-Bibb County from all damages to person or property caused by the erection or maintenance of poles, wires, or other works, or condition of streets, alleys, or public places resulting therefrom for which Macon-Bibb County would otherwise be liable or on account of which judgment may be rendered against it. 
(6)  The Georgia Power Company, its successors, lessees, and assigns, shall further, in constructing and maintaining its system of overhead lines, poles, wires and other structures, submit and be subject to all laws, rules, and regulations of Macon-Bibb County for the regulation or control of such structures. 
(7)  Macon-Bibb County shall have the right to attach fire alarm and police telephone and telegraph service to the poles belonging to Georgia Power Company, it successors and assigns, at all times without expense to the government; and none of the wires or other appliances belonging to Macon-Bibb County, after having been affixed to the poles, shall be interfered with by any employee of the company, its successors, and assigns. 
(b)  The written agreement between Georgia Power Company and the City of Macon, dated May 7, 1965, and all supplemental agreements between Georgia Power Company and the City of Macon, specifically including a letter dated December 12, 1975, and any such agreement entered into between Georgia Power Company and Macon-Bibb County are incorporated by reference. Official copies of these agreements are on file in the office of the clerk of Macon-Bibb County. 
Secs. 29-38—29-60. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE III. - GAS SERVICE 
DIVISION 1. - FRANCHISE EFFECTIVE MAY 27, 1975 

Sec. 29-61. - Continuation of gas company's franchise. 
(a)  Atlanta Gas Light Company shall exercise for a period of 40 years from the date of approval of this chapter [May 27, 1975], the franchise under which Atlanta Gas Light Company is now conducting its business of selling natural gas and any other type of gas for any and all uses to which the same may be put advantageously in the city limits of the City of Macon and on and after January 1, 2014, in Macon-Bibb County within the geographic area of the former City of Macon as well as unincorporated Bibb County, and for these purposes Atlanta Gas Light Company may, and is hereby granted the right to, lay, construct, extend, maintain, renew, replace, and repair pipes, valves, manholes, service boxes, posts, lamps, structures, appliances and all appurtenances and appendages under, along, through and across any streets, avenues, roads, public highways, alleys, lanes, ways, parks and other public places in Macon-Bibb County, and to use and occupy the streets, avenues, roads, public highways, alleys, lanes, ways, parks and other public places for the purpose of therein laying, constructing, extending, maintaining, renewing, replacing and repairing mains, pipes, valves, manholes, service boxes, posts, lamps, structures, appliances and all appurtenances and appendages thereto, used and useful for the manufacture, transmission, distribution and sale of gas, within and through the present or future territorial limits of Macon-Bibb County, such right, when exercised as herein provided, to continue for 40 years from the date of approval of this chapter [May 27, 1975]. 
(b)  In constructing, laying, maintaining, repairing, replacing, enlarging, and extending its pipes, mains, and necessary accessories in the streets and other public places, the company shall be subject to, and comply with, all ordinances, rules, and regulations of Macon-Bibb County, now or hereafter in force applicable to the use of streets and other public places. 
(c)  No excavations or work shall be done by Atlanta Gas Light Company in the streets or other places of Macon-Bibb County until a permit has been applied for by the company and granted by the official of Macon-Bibb County charged with that duty, except in emergencies, when the permit shall be obtained for the emergency work at the earliest practicable time. No permit shall be refused where the request is made in conformity to the general ordinances, rules, and regulations of the government and the purpose for which the permit is desired is not in violation of the general ordinances, rules, and regulations nor in violation of the terms of this article. 
(d)  In addition to complying with all ordinances, rules and regulations of Macon-Bibb County, where the use of the public streets and other public places are involved, the company shall at all times be subject to and comply with all other ordinances, rules and regulations of Macon-Bibb County enacted or promulgated under the police powers of Macon-Bibb County for the safety and protection of the general public. 
Sec. 29-62. - Removal or relocation of facilities. 
If any streets, roads, rights-of-way, or other public places owned by Macon-Bibb County or any water lines or mains or sanitary sewer lines or mains owned by Macon-Bibb County water and sewerage authority necessitating the removal or relocation of the Atlanta Gas Light Company facilities located therein in the furtherance of any governmental purpose, the removal or relocation shall be done by Atlanta Gas Light Company at its expense after reasonable notice, provided that the foregoing provisions of this section shall not be applicable where the street alteration or abandonment is done for the convenience of another public utility, whether publicly or privately owned, or for the convenience of any abutting landowner or any governmental agency. 
Sec. 29-63. - Rates. 
Atlanta Gas Light Company shall be entitled to charge for gas furnished by it, any rates as are prescribed by the public service commission or other lawful regulatory body of the state. 
Sec. 29-64. - Quarterly payment; right of inspection; exclusion for industrial gas. 
(a)  Atlanta Gas Light Company hereby agrees and covenants, for and in consideration of the rights and privileges herein granted to it, to pay, within 60 days following the end of each quarterly period, Macon-Bibb County three percent of the gas sales receipts received by Atlanta Gas Light Company from residential and commercial, but not industrial customers, within the territorial limits of Macon-Bibb County during the preceding quarterly period (hereinafter referred to as the quarterly period), provided, however, that should Macon-Bibb County require Atlanta Gas Light Company to pay any license fee or tax, excise tax, indirect tax, occupation tax, franchise tax, privilege tax, regulation charge or related fees, these taxes or charges shall be deducted in full by Atlanta Gas Light Company from the quarterly payment or payments subsequently accruing to Macon-Bibb County. The quarterly periods for which these payments shall be made shall commence upon the first day of the month immediately following proper adoption and approval of this article [May 27, 1975]. The commission, through its authorized representative or representatives, shall have the right to inspect and audit the books and records of Atlanta Gas Light Company for the purpose of determining the amount of its revenues received from the sale of gas to residential and commercial, but not industrial customers within Macon-Bibb County limits. 
(b)  "Industrial gas" or "gas sold to industrial customers," as to which Atlanta Gas Light Company shall pay no part of its revenue to Macon-Bibb County hereunder, is defined to be gas sold to manufacturing, assembling and processing businesses such as textile, and cotton mills, brick and tile manufacturers, glass manufacturing plants, cement plants, foundries, electric generating plants, steel and other metal plants, cotton oil mills, ice plants, bottling plants and other manufacturing plants, automobile and other assembling plants, kaolin processing plants, rubber processing plants, meat packing plants, laundries, bakeries, dairies, food processing plants, and other processing plants; and gas sold to governmental and institutional customers consuming more than 150,000 cubic feet of natural gas on any one-day during the customer's contract year and billed on an interruptible rate schedule, or under a special contract filed with the Georgia Public Service Commission, (or any successor state regulatory group). 
Sec. 29-65. - Increase in consideration. 
Should Atlanta Gas Light Company have in force on and after August 17, 1979, a contract to pay and actually be paying to any other municipality in the state receiving gas service under the same rates and similar conditions as those in effect at that particular time in Macon-Bibb County, a percentage greater than the three percent set out in this article, the three percent shall be increased to such greater percent, which greater percent shall become effective with the commencement of the next following quarterly period and remain effective so long, and only so long, as the Atlanta Gas Light Company shall pay the greater percent to another municipality. 
Sec. 29-66. - Repairs to streets. 
All excavations, construction, repair and other work done by any company in the streets or other public places of Macon-Bibb County shall be at the expense of the company, and all parts of streets and other public places shall be restored by the company so as to leave them in the same condition as before such acts on the part of the company, subject however to existing or future provisions of this Code which may provide that the restoration or replacement of pavement shall be done by Macon-Bibb County at the reasonable cost thereof to be borne by the company. The company shall compensate Macon-Bibb County for all damage to streets and other public places caused by acts or omissions of the company in making excavations, and in constructing, laying, maintaining, repairing, replacing, enlarging and extending the company's pipes, mains and other accessories. 
Sec. 29-67. - Company to indemnify city. 
Atlanta Gas Light Company shall save and keep harmless Macon-Bibb County from any and all liability by reason of damage or injury to any person or persons whomsoever, on account of negligence, wrongful act or omission, of Atlanta Gas Light Company in the installation, maintenance and repair of its mains and pipe lines along said streets, avenues, roads, public highways, alleys, lanes, ways, parks and other public places in Macon-Bibb County, provided the Atlanta Gas Light Company shall have been notified in writing of any claim against Macon-Bibb County on account thereof and shall have been given ample opportunity to defend the same. 
Sec. 29-68. - Transfer of franchise. 
Any franchise granted hereunder shall not be transferred, assigned or otherwise alienated except with the express consent of Macon-Bibb County; provided, however, that the franchisee shall have the full right and power to transfer the franchise in connection with any merger, consolidation or reorganization of the franchisee or as a part of securing the payment of any indebtedness now existing or hereafter created by the franchisee, its successors or assigns, with or without the consent of Macon-Bibb County. Each and every right and obligation of Atlanta Gas Light Company contained in this article shall extend and apply to its successors and assigns, and wherever Atlanta Gas Light Company is used herein it shall be construed to contain a specific reference to such successors and assigns. 
DIVISION 2. - FRANCHISE FEE CALCULATION AMENDMENT EFFECTIVE NOVEMBER 1, 1998 

Sec. 29-69. - Definitions. 
Base year means the fiscal year ending September 30, 1998. 
Base year franchise fee factor means the total franchise fees paid during the base year divided by the design day capacity as recorded by Atlanta Gas Light Company on the last day of the base year. 
Design day capacity means the sum of the individual capacity in dekatherms (Dt) attributable to all firm customers located within the geographic limits of Macon-Bibb County as of the last day of the previous fiscal year. 
Firm customers means all residential and business customers who purchase gas service that ordinarily is not subject to interruption or curtailment. 
Fiscal year means the 12 months ending September 30 of each year. 
Inflation index means the percentage change in the consumer price index for all urban consumers as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, or any successor index, for the period from September 30, 1997, to the beginning of the then current fiscal year. The percentage shall be reduced by any productivity factor adjustment for the same time period determined by the state public service commission for Atlanta Gas Light Company. 
Sec. 29-70. - Franchise fee. 
The total dollar amount of franchise fees paid by Atlanta Gas Light Company to Macon-Bibb County shall be calculated as follows: 
(1)  The current fiscal year total franchise fee shall equal the product of the design day capacity and the current franchise fee factor. The current franchise fee factor shall be equal to the product of the base year franchise fee factor and one plus the inflation index expressed as a decimal to three significant digits. 
(2)  The following formula quantifies this payment: 
FFc = FFFby × (1 + (CPI − PFA)) × DDc 
Where FFc = total franchise fees due the city for the current fiscal year 
FFFby = the base year franchise fee factor 
CPI - PFA = the inflation index based on the cumulative change in the consumer price index less the productivity factor adjustment determined by the Georgia Public Service Commission. 
DDCc = the design day capacity as of the last day of the previous fiscal year. 
FFFby = FFby/DDCby where 
FFby = the total franchise fees paid in the base year 
and DDCby = the design day capacity of the base year. 
Sec. 29-71. - Responsibility for payment of franchise fee. 
(a)  Atlanta Gas Light Company as the holder of the franchise privilege hereunder is responsible for the payment of all franchise fees payable hereunder and shall file such reports and returns as required by this article. In addition, Atlanta Gas Light Company shall report annually the names of all gas marketers for which Atlanta Gas Light Company is transporting natural gas on the distribution system within Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  Franchise fee payments required hereunder shall be in lieu of any franchise fee, license fee, occupation tax or other payment for use of the rights-of-way by Atlanta Gas Light Company for the provision of gas service, but shall not prohibit imposition of a license fee or an occupation tax on gas marketers. 
Sec. 29-72. - Quarterly payments. 
(a)  Effective for the fiscal year 1999, and for each fiscal year thereafter during the term of the franchise ordinance, Atlanta Gas Light Company shall remit to Macon-Bibb County quarterly franchise fee installments. The installments shall be equal to one-fourth of the total annual franchise fee calculated in accordance with this division. 
(b)  The quarterly payment is due and payable on or before the 30th day following the last day of each calendar quarter. 
Sec. 29-73. - Annual return. 
Atlanta Gas Light Company shall file a return with its first quarterly installment in each fiscal year showing the details of the calculation of the annual franchise fee. 
Sec. 29-74. - Delay of inflation adjustment. 
Notwithstanding any other provision in this division, any inflation adjustments shall be made to the franchise fee only when Atlanta Gas Light Company changes its rates. 
Sec. 29-75. - Conflicts. 
In the event of a conflict between divisions 1 and 2, division 2 shall control. All terms, conditions and stipulations contained in division 1 shall remain in full force and effect to the extent that they do not conflict with division 2. 
Secs. 29-76—29-90. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - CABLE TELEVISION SERVICE
