ARTICLE VI. - SEWERS AND DRAINS 

Sec. 29-131. - False information on application. 
No person shall file an application for connection with any sewer line owned by Macon-Bibb County or the Macon water authority, which to the knowledge of the applicant contains false or erroneous information or which results in the payment of a tap-on fee smaller than that required by Macon-Bibb County or by the Macon water authority, as the case may be. 
Sec. 29-132. - Payment of tap-on fee. 
No person shall connect directly or indirectly to any sewer line owned by Macon-Bibb County or by the Macon water authority without having paid in full the tap-on fee required by Macon-Bibb County or the authority, as the case may be. 
Sec. 29-133. - Violations. 
Any person who shall violate the provisions of this article shall, upon conviction, be punished as provided by section 1-6. 
Secs. 29-134—29-140. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE VII. - DRAINAGE AND PAVING DISTRICTS 

Sec. 29-141. - Creation of special districts by resolution. 
(a)  Whenever the board of commissioners of Macon-Bibb County shall determine that, pursuant to and in accordance with an amendment to the constitution of the state, proposed by the general assembly of the state (1943 Ga. Laws, page 8) and ratified at a general election held in June, 1943, a special drainage and/or paving district is to be established, the board of commissioners shall adopt a resolution describing such area constituting a special drainage and/or paving district, and the following provisions of this article shall in all instances apply to such drainage and/or paving district. The authority granted by the above-mentioned amendment shall apply only in that area that, prior to consolidation, encompassed the unincorporated area of Bibb County. 
(b)  In addition, the commission may, pursuant to article IX, section II, paragraph VI of the state constitution, create by resolution additional special districts for drainage and/or paving improvements for any area of Macon-Bibb County. 
(c)  The provisions of this article shall apply whether there are one or more districts created by such resolution or resolutions. 
Sec. 29-142. - Adoption of resolutions. 
Whenever the board of commissioners of Macon-Bibb County shall create a drainage and/or paving district, it shall do so by a resolution which shall define the limits of such drainage and/or paving district and any such resolution so establishing such district may by reference to this article incorporate the same therein and this article shall be as much a part of the resolution creating such drainage and/or paving district as if fully set forth therein. 
Sec. 29-143. - Purposes of resolutions; costs. 
(a)  Any resolution creating a drainage and/or paving district shall constitute a finding that, in the opinion of the board of commissioners of Macon-Bibb County, it is to the interest of the safety, convenience and health of the people residing in such district so established to improve the drainage and the condition of the streets in such district and such district shall thereby be condemned for drainage and paving, and it is hereby ordered that upon the effective date of such a resolution creating such drainage and/or paving district, that the drainage in such district be improved by the installation of storm sewers of adequate size, and that such district be paved with an asphalt surface on an adequate base, together with the necessary grading and incidental work. 
(b)  The prorata cost of the improvement described, as such portion as provided by section 29-149, as well as the costs provided by sections 29-147 and 29-148, shall be charges against the respective owners of the properties affected by the improvement and a continuing lien from the date of the resolution creating such special drainage and/or paving district to the date of full payment, against all of the properties of such owners whether affected by the improvements or not, the board of commissioners having the right and power, for and in behalf of Macon-Bibb County, to make collection from such owners or to pursue and subject for payment the properties affected by such improvements or any and all other properties of such owners. 
Sec. 29-144. - Improvements by government or contract. 
Such improvements shall be done in whole or in part by Macon-Bibb County forces or by contract as then existing conditions may dictate and be determined by the Macon-Bibb County engineer, with the approval and consent of the governing body. It is therefore ordered that such work shall be so accomplished, and the clerk of the Macon-Bibb County commission shall be authorized and directed, as to that portion of work to be accomplished by contract, to advertise for bids for furnishing all labor and materials for doing such work, as required by law. 
Sec. 29-145. - Plans, specifications and supervision of work. 
Such work shall be done in accord with plans and specifications prepared and/or approved by the Macon-Bibb County engineer, and subject to the approval of the Macon-Bibb County commission, and the work shall be performed under the supervision and direction of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
Sec. 29-146. - Publication of notice; appeals. 
The clerk of the Macon-Bibb County board of commissioners shall cause to be published at least twice before work is commenced under this article, in the official advertising organ of Macon-Bibb County, notice of the passage of the resolution, and of the intention of Macon-Bibb County to cause the described work to commence and be completed. Such notice shall also advise that any owner of property or other person affected by the proposed work, may within ten days after the last published notice, appeal to the Macon-Bibb County commission and show cause, if any he has, why such proposed work should not be done, such persons being heard upon any material or pertinent matter, affecting the validity or reasonableness of such work, and the manner and means by which it is to be accomplished. 
Sec. 29-147. - Adjustment of utilities. 
Whenever the Macon-Bibb County engineer shall notify the owners of properties abutting on any district coming under this article or of any area where a drainage and paving project will occur, to move all water meters and lower all water and gas connections, or sewer connections, necessary to the proper construction of such drainage and paving project, each property owner shall immediately have all connections adjusted according to the plans and to the satisfaction of the engineer, and should the property owner within ten days after receiving such notice, fail to have such connections properly adjusted, or notify the engineer in writing that he does not intend to have such adjustments made, the Macon-Bibb County engineer will have adjustments made, and the cost of same, plus a $15.00 charge for handling shall be added to the assessments against the properties or owners and collected in the same manner as the original assessment, and whenever the engineer shall notify the public utility companies having utilities within the districts or adjacent to any planned drainage and paving project to move, lower or adjust such utilities as may be necessary to the proper construction of such drainage and paving project, the utility companies shall immediately have all utilities adjusted according to the plans and to the satisfaction of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. Such notice may be served either by leaving same at the residence of the respective property owners or at the office of the respective utilities or by depositing the same in the U.S. mail enclosed in an envelope properly stamped and addressed to the owner. Such notice shall also advise that any person affected may within five days of the date of such notice, appeal to the Macon-Bibb County commission for an extension of time for completing such work directed in such notice. 
Sec. 29-148. - Removal of artificial obstructions. 
Whenever, in the opinion of the Macon-Bibb County engineer, there shall exist artificial obstructions within or upon the areas of the right-of-way to be improved or needed as work area for the improvement, he shall notify the property owner whose property abuts the portion of the right-of-way so obstructed to remove such obstructions within ten days of the receipt of such notice and upon failure to do so Macon-Bibb County will remove the same without responsibility or liability therefor, and will charge and assess the entire cost of such removal against the property and owner affected in all instances where the obstructions have been created or maintained by such property owner. The notice provided for in this section shall be served and an appeal allowed as provided in section 29-147. 
Sec. 29-149. - Assessment of costs. 
Immediately upon the completion of any drainage and/or paving improvement made in any area of Macon-Bibb County, the Macon-Bibb County engineer shall certify to the Macon-Bibb County commission that the work of drainage and paving has been completed; and thereupon it shall become the duty of the commission to assess the cost of the work as follows: The real estate abutting on each side of such drainage and/or paving project shall be assessed and shall together pay two-thirds of the entire cost, including the drainage, each piece of real estate to be assessed in proportion that the frontage of such realty bears to the entire frontage so paved and/or drained as by law provided. In determining the entire cost of such work to be proportionally assessed, the commission shall have the right to include the cost of construction, replacement, or repair of steps, driveways, or lateral walks whether or not situated within the right-of-way, where in the judgment of the commission, the same are necessary to ingress and egress to and from abutting property. 
Sec. 29-150. - Payment of costs. 
(a)  Immediately after the cost of paving and/or draining under this article shall have been prorated and assessed by the Macon-Bibb County commission, the Macon-Bibb County engineer shall prepare a list of the property owners whose property abuts on the paving and/or drainage project and provide it to the Macon-Bibb County tax commissioner who shall mail to the property owners a written notice or statement of the amount so assessed in a properly addressed and stamped envelope. Thereupon each property owner shall make payment for such paving and drainage so assessed against each respectively within 30 days from the date of such notice unless the board of commissioners shall have determined that extenuating circumstances exist. If the board of commissioners in its sole discretion determines that extenuating circumstances exist, the board may permit the property owners to pay the assessment in monthly or quarterly installments over a term not to exceed five years. In such instance, the written notice or statement shall be mailed to the property owners as required herein immediately after approval of the installment payment and term and the property owners shall make such payments each month during the approved term until such assessment shall have been paid in full. 
(b)  In the event that any property owner shall fail to pay the Macon-Bibb County tax commissioner his assessment within 30 days from the date of such notice, or in the case where payment is approved in monthly or quarterly installments as set forth in subsection (a), each month or quarter during the approved payment term, then the Macon-Bibb County board of commissioners or its designated agent shall issue an execution against such delinquent property owner for the amount due and unpaid, together with all costs thereon, and each execution shall bear interest at the rate then in effect and applicable to executions for delinquent ad valorem taxes; provided, however, that in computing interest, a fraction of a month shall be charged as a full month. Any property owner failing to pay the tax commissioner his assessment within the time provided for in this section shall pay, in addition to the principal amount, such interest as is currently applicable from time to time. 
(c)  The execution issued by the Macon-Bibb County board of commissioners or its designated agent, as provided for in this section shall bind and be a lien upon all property of such delinquent owner abutting on such improvements or served thereby and shall be a special lien superior to all other liens except for taxes upon such property. The execution shall be collected and defenses thereto may be made in the manner provided by law with respect to ad valorem taxes. 
Sec. 29-151. - Article cumulative. 
The action taken in this article and the method provided for the collection of the assessments shall be cumulative of all rights of Macon-Bibb County otherwise afforded by law, including any and all contracts and petitions of property owners for the paving and drainage. 
Sec. 29-152. - Errors in assessments. 
Any errors made in the assessments provided for in this article may be corrected at any time by reassessment. 
ARTICLE VIII. - SPECIAL SANITARY SEWERAGE DISTRICT 

Sec. 29-153. - Creation of special districts to facilitate expansion of sanitary sewerage service for Macon-Bibb County Residents. 
This section and the following sections, through and including section 29-165, provide for the means by which there may be created and established special districts for the acquisition of all necessary easements for, and construction and installation of, all infrastructure necessary to provide sewerage for sanitary sewage conveyance services to properties within said districts, and to provide a means of funding therefor through fees, assessments, and taxes that may be levied and collected within such districts to pay, wholly or partially, the cost thereof. These sections of this Code may be collectively referred to as the "Special Sanitary Sewerage District Ordinance." 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-154 - Purpose for special district. 
The special districts shall be created for the following purposes: 
To provide a means funding acquisition of all necessary easements for, and construction, and installation of, all infrastructure necessary to provide sewerage for sanitary sewage conveyance services to properties within the special districts. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-155. - Requesting creation of district. 
(a)  When sanitary sewage conveyance services are desired by residents and property owners of an existing neighborhood or subdivision that received final plat approval at least two (2) years prior to the submission of the application fee described in subsection (b), those residents and property owners may, by application submitted to the Board of Commissioners, request the creation of a special district to fund the construction and installation of all infrastructure necessary to provide the services throughout the following procedure: 
(b)  The application referred to in subsection (a), forms for which will be available from the Macon Water Authority, shall be signed by the owners of more than fifty percent (50%) of the lots in the requesting neighborhood or subdivision and shall be accompanied by a non-refundable application fee equal to one hundred dollars ($100.00) multiplied by one-half (½) the number of lots in the development to be served by the special district, but in no event shall the application fee be less than twenty-five hundred dollars ($2,500.00). The Clerk shall verify that the application and fee satisfy the criteria set forth in this subsection. 
(c)  If the application and fee satisfy the criteria set forth in subsection (b), the Clerk shall deliver the fee and a copy of the application to the Macon Water Authority with a request that the Macon Water Authority conduct a feasibility study to determine the appropriate boundaries of the special district, to prepare a plat showing the proposed special district, to estimate the cost of providing sewer service to the district including but not limited to engineering, easement acquisition, construction, construction observation, permits, and debt service, to estimate the necessary millage rate for the special district and the number of years the district must exist to provide the funding for the project, and to render an opinion as to whether the project is otherwise appropriate for a special district. The Macon Water Authority will deliver a copy of the report of the feasibility study to the Board of Commissioners and to each applicant whose signature appears on the application. The Macon Water Authority may retain the application fee to help defray the cost of the feasibility study and dissemination thereof. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-156. - Public hearing required. 
Following dissemination of the report of the feasibility study as aforesaid, the Board of Commissioners shall conduct a public hearing for the purpose of determining whether or not to create the proposed special district, giving consideration to the report, to the comments by interested members of the public, and any other health, safety, and welfare concerns. The public hearing shall be advertised one (1) time in the official organ of the County; and at least one (1) sign shall be posted in the proposed special district giving notice of the hearing, at least fifteen (15) days before the public hearing. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-157. - Petition to establish special district. 
Following the public hearing, the Board of Commissioners shall determine by a majority vote whether to accept a petition, from owners of the property within the boundaries of the proposed district as described by the report of the feasibility study, to establish a special district fitting the criteria specified in the report of the feasibility study. If the Board of Commissioners vote to accept a petition, the Board of Commissioners may establish a deadline by which the petition must be submitted. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-158. - Special district established. 
If the owners of sixty-five percent (65%) of the lots in the proposed special district sign the petition for the creation of a special district conforming to the criteria set forth in the report of the feasibility study, the Board of Commissioners shall declare that the district is created. Once created, the district shall continue to exist until the cost of the project and the indebtedness of the Macon Water Authority for the completion of the project is retired. A plat describing the district shall be filed with Clerk of the County Superior Court and the County Engineer. Plats shall also be available to the public for inspection at the Macon Water Authority and at the offices of the Board of Commissioners. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-159. - Project construction. 
Whenever a special district is created, the County shall enter into a contract with the Macon Water Authority for the construction of the project. The contact shall include a statement of the scope of the project, and shall provide that responsibility for funding and managing the project shall belong to the Macon Water Authority. The contract shall provide that upon completion of the project, title to the infrastructure and any necessary easements shall be in the name of the Macon Water Authority. It shall further provide that responsibility for the maintenance of the completed sewer infrastructure shall belong to Macon Water Authority. It shall further provide that the assessments collected in the special district will be paid over to the Macon Water Authority to fund the full cost of the project, to reimburse the County for its costs and expenses incurred in performing its responsibilities set forth in Sections 29-155 through 29-158 with respect to the special district, and to retire any indebtedness incurred by the Macon Water Authority to fund the project. The contract shall contain a commitment obligating the Board of Commissioners to utilize all reasonable means, including but not limited to execution, levy, foreclosure, and sale, to collect any delinquent assessments imposed pursuant to this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance. If the project as proposed includes excess capacity, the contrast shall include a statement explaining how any basin specific fee would be established and how said fees would offset the construction cost owed by the special district. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-160. - Assessments imposed, how collected. 
The Board of Commissioners shall establish an annual assessment to be imposed upon each of the lots in the district. Payment of the first assessment shall be due concurrently with the due date for payment of ad valorem taxes for the calendar year in which the district is created. Payment shall be due annually thereafter until the cost of the project and the indebtedness of the Macon Water Authority for the completion of the project are retired. The office of the Tax Commissioner shall be responsible for the collection of the assessments for each special district. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-161. - Lien created. 
In addition to any other rights of collection for late or unpaid charges, the County shall have the rights available under the laws of the State for assessment, including the creation of a lien upon the property the assessment for which is not timely paid, together with all rights of execution, levy, foreclosure, and sale. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-162. - Property owners' expenses associated with connecting to installed sewerage infrastructure. 
No part of the assessments collected in the special district shall be used to defray the cost of connecting to installed sewerage infrastructure. All such costs shall be borne by property owners' who desire to make such connection, in accordance with policies and practices of the Macon Water Authority in effect from time to time. Connection to the infrastructure is not required as a condition of the establishment of the district, but every property against which assessments are made shall have the right to connect to the infrastructure, in accordance with said policies and practices of the Macon Water Authority. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-163. - Severability. 
If any section, subsection, sentence, clause, or phrase of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance is, for any reason, held to be invalid, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-164. - Conflict of laws. 
If any provision of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance is in conflict with any state or federal law, or with any rule, regulation, or order of any agency of this state or federal agency having jurisdiction of the subject matter of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance, it is hereby deemed to be the intention of the Board of Commissioners that the state or federal law or rule, regulation, or order, as the case may be, shall prevail so that the remaining portion of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance shall be deemed to be of full force and effect. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Sec. 29-165. - No wavier. 
If the intent of this Special Sanitary Sewerage District ordinance to protect the public health, safety, and general welfare of all properties and persons in general, but not to create any special duty or relationship with any individual person or to any specified property within or without the unincorporated boundaries of the County. The County expressly reserves the right to assert all available immunities and defenses in any action seeking to imposed monetary damages upon the County, its officers, employees, and agents arising out of any alleged failure or breach of duty or relationship as may now exist or hereafter be created. To the extent any permit, plan approval, inspection, or similar act is required by the County as a condition precedent to any activity by or upon property not owned by the County, pursuant to this or any other regulatory ordinance, regulation, or rule of the County or under federal or state law, the issuance of such permit, plan, approval, or inspection shall not be deemed to constitute a warranty, express or implied, nor shall such issuance afford the basis for any action, including any action based on failure to permit or negligent issuance of a permit, seeking the imposition of money damages against the County, its officers, employees, or agents. 
( Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 1, 8-19-2014 ) 
Secs. 29-166—29-170. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IX. - WATER SYSTEM[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 2, adopted August 19, 2014, renumbered art. VIII, §§ 29-171—29-189, as art. IX, §§ 29-171—29-189. 

Sec. 29-171. - Permit for water or gas main. 
No person shall hereafter lay any water pipe or main, gas pipe or main, or any other main upon any part of the public streets or highways within Macon-Bibb County without first having obtained a permit therefor from the Macon-Bibb County engineer as provided in section 29-2. 
Sec. 29-172. - Depth of pipe or main. 
No such pipe or main shall be laid upon any such street or highway unless the same is at least 30 inches below the grade of such street or highway, and any pipe so laid shall be upon condition that the same will be changed wholly at the expense of the property owner or applicant, to conform to any new grade which may be hereafter established for the street or highway on which it is located, so as to be at all times at least 30 inches below the grade of such street or highway. 
Sec. 29-173. - Depth of present pipes and mains. 
The owners or users of any mains or pipes now existing within the area of Macon-Bibb County are permitted to continue the use of such highways only on condition that such mains or pipes now are, or shall be within 30 days of the direction of the Macon-Bibb County engineer as needed to protect the existing road and drainage system, placed at least 30 inches below present grade, and upon the change of grade in any such highway hereafter, such owner or users will likewise be required at his own expense to adjust such mains or pipes so that they at all times will be at least 30 inches below the grade of such highway. 
Sec. 29-174. - Pavement repair charge. 
Before the Macon-Bibb County engineer shall issue to any person a permit to lay any water, gas, sewer pipe or any other pipe or conduit on any public road or street of Macon-Bibb County which is paved in such a manner as to necessitate the disturbing of the pavement, such person shall pay to the Macon-Bibb County engineer an inspection fee to be established by the Macon-Bibb County engineer, which amount is set as the minimum charge for replacing or repairing the pavement damaged by the excavation, and no portion of which shall be returned to the holder of the permit. 
Sec. 29-175. - Conditions and regulations. 
All permits shall be issued and all pipe and conduits shall be installed subject to and in accord with the following conditions and regulations: 
(1)  No pipe nor conduit shall be installed less than 30 inches deep. 
(2)  No excavation shall be made under the pavement larger than the hole in the pavement. 
(3)  The excavation shall be properly backfilled and the backfill material thoroughly tamped into place, the material being left slightly higher than the pavement to allow for settlement, and should settlement occur, the party making the excavation shall keep same filled up with satisfactory material until pavement is repaired. 
(4)  Adequate barricades, proper signage, and lights shall be provided by the party making the excavation at all times during construction and until pavement is repaired. 
(5)  Upon completion of construction and the proper filling of the excavation the contractor shall notify the Macon-Bibb County engineer that the work is complete and that the pavement may be repaired. 
(6)  After, in the opinion of the Macon-Bibb County engineer, sufficient time has elapsed for the backfill to properly settle, the pavement shall be repaired by Macon-Bibb County forces. 
(7)  No parties other than Macon-Bibb County forces shall repair or replace any pavement without the express consent of the Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
(8)  No pipe or conduit shall be laid at such a grade or in such a manner as to disturb any existing cross-drain, culvert, pipe, storm sewer, sanitary sewer, side-drain pipe or other existing pipe, nor less than four inches above the top or below the bottom of any existing pipe or culvert. 
Sec. 29-176. - Duties of Macon-Bibb County engineer. 
The Macon-Bibb County engineer shall have prepared proper forms for the applications for permits, and for the permits, and the engineer shall keep a complete and accurate record of all permits issued, all charges made and all payments received. 
Sec. 29-177. - Removal of pipe or conduit. 
The Macon-Bibb County engineer is hereby authorized and instructed to remove from the right-of-way of any public road or street, any pipe or conduit which is not installed in accordance with the foregoing regulations or which is installed without a permit having first been obtained even though it be otherwise properly installed, and to replace the roadway in the same condition as it was before the installation. 
Sec. 29-178. - Water line connections regulated. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to connect to the water lines constructed by the Macon water authority without having previously obtained a permit so to do from the Macon-Bibb County engineer; provided, however, that this section shall not apply to connections for fire suppression lines. 
Sec. 29-179. - Water meter required. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to connect to a water line belonging to the Macon water authority without having installed a water meter for the purpose of measuring the water consumed through the tap so made; provided, however, that this section shall not apply to connections for fire suppression lines. 
Sec. 29-180. - Tampering with meter prohibited. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to tamper with any meter installed by the Macon water authority or by the former board of water commissioners of the City of Macon so as to render it inoperable, or otherwise impair its proper operation. 
Sec. 29-181. - Bypassing meter prohibited. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to install any water service line or to alter any previously installed water service line so as to cause the same to bypass any meter located upon a service line which itself is connected with a water line owned by the Macon water authority. 
Sec. 29-182. - Consumption of water regulated. 
It shall be unlawful for any person owning or occupying business or residential premises to permit the consumption of water upon such premises, if such water has been obtained through the water system operated by or for the account of the Macon water authority, unless such water so consumed has passed through a water meter in good operating condition which accurately measures the amount of water passing through such meter; provided, however, that this section shall not apply to fire suppression lines. 
Sec. 29-183. - Payment of bills. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to fail to pay, promptly when due, any bills for water consumed or for other charges rendered by the Macon water authority, or by its agent. 
Sec. 29-184. - Payment of money due authority. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to do any act or to omit to do any act whether or not specifically hereinabove set forth which results in the failure of such person to pay any sums of money due to the Macon water authority, or to its agent for the account of the authority which are properly due and owing. 
Sec. 29-185. - Each day a separate offense. 
Each day that any such person remains in violation of this resolution [chapter] shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as such. 
Sec. 29-186. - Penalty. 
Any person charged with the violation of this chapter shall be tried in the municipal court of Macon-Bibb County, and, upon conviction, shall be punished as provided by the laws of the state pertaining to that court except that the penalties and punishment shall be as provided in section 1-6. 
Sec. 29-187. - Findings and purpose. 
Macon-Bibb County finds that there is an imminent need to foster a culture of water conservation and to plan for water supply enhancement during future extreme drought conditions and other water emergencies; and that reasonable restrictions on the outdoor watering of landscape are necessary in furtherance of addressing this need. 
The purposes and intent in enacting sections 29-187 through 29-189 are as follows, and to these ends the said regulations are hereby adopted: 
(1)  To address outdoor watering of landscape to promote conservation of water and enhance water supply; and 
(2)  To comply with the mandate of the Georgia General Assembly (Senate Bill 370) that all counties adopt an ordinance limiting outdoor watering of landscape to the hours between 4:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. (with certain exceptions) to take effect not later than January 1, 2011. 
(3)  This section is enacted pursuant to authority granted under O.C.G.A. § 12-5-7, to regulate the outdoor watering of landscape in Macon-Bibb County. 
Sec. 29-188. - Restriction on outdoor watering of landscape. 
Outdoor watering for purposes of planting, growing, managing, or maintaining ground cover, trees, shrubs, or other plants in Macon-Bibb County may occur only between the hours of 4:00 p.m. and 10:00 a.m.; provided, however, that this limitation shall not create any limitation upon the following outdoor water uses: 
(1)  Commercial raising, harvesting, or storing of crops; feeding, breeding, or managing livestock or poultry; the commercial production or storing of feed for use in the production of livestock, including, but not limited to, cattle, calves, swine, hogs, goats, sheep, and rabbits, or for use in the production of poultry, including, but not limited to, chickens, hens, ratites, and turkeys; producing plants, trees, fowl, or animals; or the commercial production of aqua cultural, horticultural, dairy, livestock, poultry, eggs, and apiarian products or as otherwise defined in O.C.G.A. § 1-3-3; 
(2)  Capture and reuse of cooling system condensate or storm water in compliance with applicable Macon-Bibb County ordinances and state guidelines; 
(3)  Reuse of gray water in compliance with O.C.G.A. § 31-3-5.2 and applicable local board of health regulations; 
(4)  Use of reclaimed waste water by a designated user from a system permitted by the environmental protection division of the state department of natural resources to provide reclaimed waste water; 
(5)  Watering personal food gardens; 
(6)  Watering new and replanted plant, seed, or turf in landscapes, golf courses, or sports turf fields during installation and for a period of 30 days immediately following the date of installation; 
(7)  Drip irrigation or irrigation using soaker hoses; 
(8)  Hand watering with a hose with automatic cutoff or handheld container; 
(9)  Use of water withdrawn from private water wells or surface water by an owner or operator of property. If such well or surface water is on said property; 
(10)  Watering horticultural crops held for sale, resale, or installation; 
(11)  Watering athletic fields, golf courses, or public turf grass recreational areas; 
(12)  Installation, maintenance, or calibration of irrigation systems; or 
(13)  Hydro seeding. 
Sec. 29-189. - Enforcement. 
(a)  No person shall use or allow the use of water in violation of the restrictions on outdoor water use contained in the ordinance from which this section derives. 
(b)  The Macon water authority shall be the enforcement authority for the ordinance from which this section derives. The Macon-Bibb County board of commissioners may also authorize other departments as may be deemed necessary to support enforcement. 
(c)  Criminal and alternative penalties. Any violation of this section may also be enforced by a citation returnable to the municipal court or by any other legal means as set forth in this Code. 
Secs. 29-190—29-200. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE X. - RESIDENTIAL STREET LIGHTING[2] 

Footnotes: 
--- (2) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, adopted March 1, 2016 , repealed art. X, divs. 1, 2, §§ 29-201—29-206, 29-211—29-215, in its entirety; and enacted a new art. X to read as set out herein. Former art. X pertained to similar subject matter, and was derived from Original Code and Ord. No. O-14-0045, § 2, adopted August 19, 2014 . 

Sec. 29-201. - Statement of policy. 
(a)  Macon-Bibb County recognizes that residential street lighting is necessary to illuminate public streets and pedestrian infrastructure. It is the policy of Macon-Bibb County to assist residents in the installation and maintenance of essential residential street lighting in order to provide such services. It is the intent of Macon-Bibb County that all areas receive consistent treatment and requests for lighting shall be considered in order to ensure that areas are safe for vehicular and pedestrian traffic. Any secondary benefit such as perceived personal security, or the lighting of yards, driveways, or private property is considered coincidental. 
(b)  Unless installed by a utility company, Macon-Bibb County shall be responsible for the costs associated with the maintenance, installation, and operation of all approved residential street lights located on public streets. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-202. - Petition for installation of street lighting on existing public streets. 
This policy follows the standard County process for citizen response to provide uniformity and ensure responsiveness and accountability. 
(a)  Requests for new street lights and/or changes in existing street lights on existing roadways must be made in writing to the Director of Facilities Management. Requests should include the primary concern, an individual contact person for follow up, and a non-refundable fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) for the administrative costs of review of the area. Requests will be logged and included on the County's list of street light requests. 
When an organized group is active, i.e., homeowners association (HOA), civic association or other, the request shall be submitted by that entity. If no formal group exists, the request may be made by an individual or group of individuals. 
Requests for street light changes may include, but are not limited to, the following: 
• Additional/fewer lights 
• Rearrangement of lights 
• Refurbishing of lights 
(b)  Upon receipt of the street light request, a field survey shall be conducted by Facilities Management, or its designee, to determine the existing lighting conditions including number of street lights, locations, spacing, fixture types, poles, and any other pertinent information. An inspection may take place at night hours if deemed necessary to properly assess the area. 
(c)  Macon-Bibb County shall only approve petitions in areas that have above-ground utility poles, with lighting sources attached. Pole installation may be done by agreement of the property owners with the power company serving the district, or by any other method which Macon-Bibb County determines to be satisfactory. All existing poles or installed poles must be approved by the Macon-Bibb County Engineer, or their designee, prior to installation. 
(d)  If installation is recommended by the Director of Facilities Management, or their designee, upon review of the area, the community shall circulate a petition to the impacted neighboring property owners. The impacted neighboring property owners are defined as any property owner that has all or a portion of their property within a 300 foot radius of a requested street light modification. The requestor must obtain approval of at least 65% of the property owners petitioned unless a single light is requested, at which point 100% of the property owners must be in favor of the additional street light. All properties in the impacted area must be contacted. If a property owner does not respond, it will be counted as a no vote. If a legitimate safety problem can be documented, the Director of Facilities Management, or their designee, shall have the authority to waive the petition process. 
(e)  Once the petition is verified, a map shall be drawn of the area showing any existing street lighting. Facilities Management, or their designee, shall prepare a recommendation and estimated costs of such work, including installation of lights, maintenance costs, and electricity costs. 
(f)  All findings, costs, and recommendations shall then be submitted via resolution to the Macon-Bibb County Commission for consideration and approval of installation. The Macon-Bibb County Commission shall assess each petition individually on the merits and shall be required to identify funding for any approved projects. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-203. - Petition for installation of street lighting on existing private streets. 
Macon-Bibb County shall not be responsible for the installation, operation, or maintenance costs associated with the installation of street lighting on private streets. Facilities Management and/or County Engineering staff may work with the neighborhood association and/or utility company to design a plan that shall meet County specifications, if directed by the Macon-Bibb County Commission. Neighborhood associations or other private entities will be responsible for the cost of installation and all ongoing maintenance and power costs for street lights on private streets. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-204. - Installation of lighting in new developments. 
(a)  Prior to the commencement of subdivision construction and prior to any permits being issued, all developers of new subdivisions and other new projects in Macon-Bibb County shall provide for street lighting in such development and shall submit to the Director of the Facilities Management Department and the County Engineer plans as to the proposed location, type and installation specifications of all street lights in the subdivision for a determination as to compliance with the lighting requirements of Macon-Bibb County. 
(b)  Upon completion of the street lighting system and prior to formal acceptance by Macon-Bibb County for the maintenance and operation of the street lighting system, all developers must provide the Director of the Facilities Management Department and the County Engineer with proof that all costs of installation of the street lighting system have been paid, and obtain written approval from the Director of the Facilities Management Department and the County Engineer that the street lighting system complies with the lighting requirements of Macon-Bibb County. In addition, developer must submit a copy of the final "as-built" drawings to the Director of the Facilities Management Department and the County Engineer prior to such written approval being granted. Costs of installation of the street lighting system in new developments are to be paid by the developer. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-205. - Lighting requirements for area formerly known as the unincorporated Bibb County. 
For street lighting installed in the area formerly known as the unincorporated Bibb County, the following standards are required: 
(a)  Lighting fixtures installed within the public rights-of-way to be operated for the purpose of residential street illumination shall comply with the American National Standard Practice for Roadway Lighting, dated July 1, 1973, referred to above. 
(b)  Luminaries or fixtures installed within the public rights-of-way as "security lights" or for the purpose of lighting areas other than the public street shall be mounted on the side of the pole opposite from such street and shall be oriented in such a manner that the lateral light distribution pattern is parallel to the street and the vertical light distribution, at the initial light source, is perpendicular to the street so as to protect the users of the street from objectionable glare. Such security lights shall not be installed without the prior approval of Macon-Bibb County. 
(c)  Other lighting fixtures to be installed within or without public rights-of-way for any purpose whatever shall be installed in such a manner as to prevent glare from being a hazard, or interfering with the normal use of public rights-of-way. 
(d)  Fixtures for illuminating areas adjoining the public streets, roads, etc., such as parking areas, driveways, etc., will be mounted in such a manner as to insure that the light pattern is kept off the public roadway. When street or roadway lighting luminaries are to be used for "security lighting," they will be mounted on the side of the pole that is opposite from the public street and will be mounted to insure that the lateral light distribution pattern is parallel to the street and the vertical light distribution at the initial light source is perpendicular to the street. 
(e)  If lighting fixtures of a type other than those in the classification of street or roadway luminaries are to be used or if the proposed lighting is to be for other than drives, parking areas or other similar area lighting, the plans and specifications submitted will be sufficiently detailed to clearly show that such a proposal is in compliance with these standards and will not cause a hazard to, or interfere with, the normal use of the public streets, roads or highways. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-206. - Lighting requirements for area formerly known as City of Macon. 
For street lighting installed in the area formerly known as the City of Macon, the Urban Code of Street Lighting is hereby adopted by reference and all requirements of such Code shall be abided by. A copy of the code is on file with the Macon-Bibb County Clerk and additional copies of the code may be obtained from the Director of Facilities Management. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Sec. 29-207. - Abolishment of all previous street lighting districts. 
(a)  All previously enacted and approved street lighting districts located in Macon-Bibb County are hereby abolished and terminated. The fees incurred by such street lighting districts are hereby discontinued and said fees shall prorated and cease to accrue as of July 1, 2016. 
(b)  Any fees or outstanding balances due on previously approved street lighting districts accrued prior to July 1, 2016 shall remain collectable and due, however, no further fees or obligations shall be incurred. 
( Ord. No. O-16-0027, § 1, 3-1-2016 ) 
Secs. 29-208—29-2015. - Reserved.
